channel.id: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Luke Doonan and Jasmine Harman help a couple who have lived in the same home for 40 years decide between new properties either side of the Channel. Sheila is drawn to Bodmin, Cornwall, where she spent her childhood holidays, while Fred is keen to up sticks to Limousin in France.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A couple have decided to sell their family home to fund their dreams of a house abroad. Jonnie Irwin helps them look for a smaller house in Cirencester where they already live, while Laura Hamilton takes them around properties in western France where they want to spend their retirement.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Property experts Jonnie Irwin and Laura Hamilton help a couple on the verge of retirement decide between homes either side of the Channel. While Tony has his eye on Shropshire, an area he feels is familiar and beautiful, Kimm is drawn to the French way of life the Dordogne offers.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin and Laura Hamilton help a married couple who cannot decide whether to buy a property in Provence or Keswick. While Enid has been dreaming of life in the south of France for as long as she can remember, Dennis is more interested in the scenery of the Lake District.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect looks back at some of the most creative builds he has encountered on his travels around the world, from a stunning glass house overlooking Italy's Lake Lugano to an ingenious studio apartment in Barcelona featuring high tech multi-functional furniture. Plus, a unique German water tower and a Texan house made of beer cans.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are in south-west London to help another two couples find their dream home. Long-distance partners Jason and Jaye are looking for a one-bed pad with outside space in Clapham or Brixton to finally bring them together, while Hannah and Frank want a family home before they get married - but have viewed nearly 50 properties without finding the one they want.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two couples who struggled to find their first marital home, including Rupreet and Sundeep who had their hearts set on a specific area in Harrow. Phil also revisits Paul and Elly, who searched for a property in Bristol, to see if they found the perfect house.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Triathletes Ron and Mel plan to sell their family home and buy two new properties with the proceeds. The pair look for a small house in the area of Kent where they already live and a ski chalet in the Les Gets area of France, where they want to enjoy winter and summer sports with friends and family.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Businesswoman Karen would like to invest in a property and has a flexible budget of £280,000. Karen is torn: her heart is pulling her towards a new life abroad, but her adult daughter Danielle wishes her to remain in Britain. While Jasmine Harman finds her some tempting offers in Chamonix in the French Alps, Jonnie Irwin shows her the trendy east side of London.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Gary Fitzpatrick and Shahine Korimbocus want a holiday home in the tranquil Limousin area of France where they can enjoy an outdoor lifestyle with their 20-month-old twins Charlie and Catherine, and Gary's son Dominic. Brought up with French culture in Mauritius, Shahine wants the children to share her enjoyment of it, and to pick up the language. With a budget of £88,000, Scarlette Douglas sets out to help the family find their perfect house.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Stomp, a 13-year-old male okapi, is being encouraged to mate with younger female K'Tusha. But on his first attempt, he snaps his horn and causes K'Tusha a minor injury. Cameras at Chester Zoo also follow African painted dogs as they compete to be pack leader, and Raja the Bornean river turtle meets two prospective mates.(n)

programme.title: Titanic: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Investigative journalist and Titanic expert Senan Molony examines recently recovered photographs of the doomed ship, which provide fresh insight into the reasons for its sinking. The images reveal a strange mark on the hull, which may prove previously overlooked stories of a fire raging in the boiler room. This blaze may explain why the captain chose to ignore warnings of icebergs ahead and why the vessel sank so quickly after the fatal collision.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Thirty-year-old Chris is admitted after sustaining a potentially life-threatening wound during a game with his friend Jack, who fired the inside shaft of a ballpoint pen into his abdomen using an air rifle. College student Lennon has injured his head after jumping into a door frame while kicking a balloon, while 74-year-old Stafford arrives at A&E because his internal cardiac defibrillator keeps shocking him.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Cameras follow the drama at Liverpool Women's Hospital, where Jodie, 19, found out that she was pregnant after she had a fling with Stephen, 22. He's determined to see his parental responsibilities through, including being at her bedside during a long labour. Also featured is 44-year-old Derroll, who met his wife Maria online. She's a mother of four and wants him to experience fatherhood for himself, but it's not without its challenges.(n)

programme.title: Kitchen 999: Emergency Chefs
programme.desc: Chefs are known for being fiery and temperamental. But what happens when they walk out, leaving restaurants in the lurch? These days, desperate owners call the relief agency for an emergency chef, who must master unfamiliar menus, handle inexperienced staff and satisfy demanding owners and customers. Here, cameras follows three such chefs as they descend on a luxury London hotel, a Devon manor house and a busy Midlands pub.(n)

programme.title: 16 Kids and Counting
programme.desc: Cameras return to the Radfords family home as Lancashire pie-maker Noel, Sue and the children prepare to welcome a new baby to their ever-growing brood and only weeks later set off on their most ambitious family holiday to date. In Australia, the Radfords meet that nation's biggest family, the Bonnells, who have 16 kids but enforce much stricter house rules. As the Radfords explore Australia's Gold Coast, cooking kangaroo pies for their hosts and falling out with each other on the other side of the world.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A couple who have spent their lives saving stray animals bring in a three-legged cat called Jersey, who has recently become lame in her single back leg. The vet must decide whether the first-ever hip replacement on a three-legged cat is viable. Plus, a Great Dane that is two metres long is given a custom-designed spinal implant, and a Dogue de Bordeaux gets help with elbow dysplasia.(n)

programme.title: Auction of a Lifetime
programme.sub-title: Marilyn Monroe: Auction of a Lifetime.
programme.desc: Documentary exploring Marilyn Monroe's life story, told through some of her most personal and glamorous possessions, and interviews with those who knew her well. The programme focuses on an auction that took place in November 2016 in Los Angeles, where many of the Hollywood icon's most sought-after belongings were sold.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Opinionated TV viewers share their critiques of Kitchen 999: Emergency Chefs, the final of The Voice, Alone with the In-Laws, Line of Duty, Life Story, One Born Every Minute and the News.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to the Prohibition Grille in Everett, Washington, where he meets belly dancer-turned-restaurateur Rishi Brown, who is making all the wrong moves with her business. Distracted from the task of improving her menu by performing for customers, she's oblivious to the disastrous dishes being served from her own kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James has two days to turn around a £100,000 loan on a sapphire and diamond ring, while a former fashionista approaches Claudia about her designer handbag collection. A yoga devotee wants a loan on items from her past so she can invest in the future, and James has to make a snap decision on an Italian classic scooter.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Sharon and Steve try to find a buyer for financial adviser Ray and his girlfriend Eve, while Casas Manuel is helping Brian and Esther from Glasgow to find a home in Alicante.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil visits Stamford, Lincolnshire, where Mark and Tina Harrison's three-bedroom home needs a revamp to help it appeal to younger buyers. He also discovers a house that is being pitched at the family market with no success. It has the right size, a decent garden and a good location, but with stains on almost every carpet, the owners need to put a lot of work into it. Can the expert turn both properties around in just one week?.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Kat Cole goes undercover among the workforce of her company Cinnabon Incorporated, which serves sweet treats from more than 900 bakeries in 40 countries worldwide. Kat has come a long way after being raised by a single mother who fed her family of three girls on $10 a week. She seeks advice from her old boss, former Hooters CEO Coby Brooks, who also went undercover, in his own organisation. Kat has some lofty goals for Cinnabon to become a worldwide food brand, and wants to make sure that the new products she has put in place are working before she implements her plans.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Bruce `Two Dogs' Bozsum, the chairman of a Native American gaming and entertainment empire, goes undercover among his own employees to learn how he might be able to improve his organisation and ensure it flourishes for generations to come. He poses as a reality TV contestant who is trying to win funds to start up his own business, before revealing his true identity and offering rewards to some of the memorable people he has met.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin and Laura Hamilton help a married couple who cannot decide whether to buy a property in Provence or Keswick. While Enid has been dreaming of life in the south of France for as long as she can remember, Dennis is more interested in the scenery of the Lake District.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Lee and fiancee Nicky begin the competition in Bristol with an Italian-themed menu, followed by Libby and Graham, who have been married for 54 years, and lively couple Nico and Sky.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jade and Stuart kick off the competition from Essex with a fun and spontaneous menu, entertaining rivals Mark and Diane, and Chris and Rosella.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay tries to help a struggling seafood restaurant in Manhattan, where the three owners regularly come into conflict as they each try to assert their authority over the business, causing confusion for all. When one of the trio stubbornly resists the changes the Scottish chef is hoping to implement, sparks begin to fly.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef takes on one of his toughest challenges yet, J Willy's Bar and Grille in South Bend, Indiana, which has amassed debts of more than $1million. On finding an inexperienced chef serving food from both the freezer and tins, together with service that reduces one customer to tears, Gordon Ramsay orders an overnight deep-clean of the premises and designs a menu to inspire the kitchen staff.(n)

programme.title: Spying on the Royals
programme.desc: The conclusion of the two-part documentary about surveillance on Edward VIII and Wallis Simpson. In the wake of the abdication, the couple took a holiday in America, unaware they were being spied on by US intelligence agencies as well as British. The outbreak of the Second World War saw them move on to Lisbon, where their dealings with a known Nazi collaborator raised concerns for MI5.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A couple who have spent their lives saving stray animals bring in a three-legged cat called Jersey, who has recently become lame in her single back leg. The vet must decide whether the first-ever hip replacement on a three-legged cat is viable. Plus, a Great Dane that is two metres long is given a custom-designed spinal implant, and a Dogue de Bordeaux gets help with elbow dysplasia.(n)

programme.title: Three Wives, One Husband
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on the complications of bereavement in the Rockland community. Melinda and Anazella's husband Jim recently died of cancer. His dying wish was for his brother Abel to marry his two widows and bring up his seven children - but Abel has three wives already, and the prospect of further upheaval is daunting for them. Although Jim's death has united Melinda and Anazella in grief, they must now choose whether to stay together as a family and risk living through the heartache of plural marriage again, or go their own way.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Opinionated TV viewers share their critiques of Kitchen 999: Emergency Chefs, the final of The Voice, Alone with the In-Laws, Line of Duty, Life Story, One Born Every Minute and the News.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The popular armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, featuring Line of Duty, University Challenge, Rio Ferdinand: Being Mum and Dad, Comic Relief, Broadchurch, One Night with my Ex, All Round to Mrs Brown's and the News.(n)

programme.sub-title: Now You See Abby, Now You Don't.
programme.desc: Maddie and Brynn compete head to head with solo routines and Abby makes an announcement that could tear the team apart. American reality series about the world of competitive dance.(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.desc: Bridget inadvertently mocks one of Kerry's art exhibits, and Jim finds himself a success with the ladies at a speed-dating event - much to CJ's dismay. Starring Kaley Cuoco, James Garner and David Spade.(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.desc: Bridget and Kerry are allowed to use the minivan on the strict understanding they chauffeur Rory wherever he needs to go - but fail to keep their promise, prompting him to take matters into his own hands. Comedy, starring Kaley Cuoco and Amy Davidson.(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.desc: Bridget has to organise the school Halloween dance, but is in danger of being distracted by Pete. Meanwhile, Jim falls foul of a gang of rowdy trick-or-treaters. Starring Kaley Cuoco and David Spade.(n)

programme.desc: Michael Jr and Vanessa announce their engagement, so Michael and Jay plan a wedding reception with dolphins, a castle and 751 guests.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Michael makes the unwise decision to take a vow of silence while away on a meditation weekend with Jay.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Kyles go to the Bahamas on holiday, and as soon as they arrive Michael announces he wants to have a relaxing, peaceful time.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Jay worries about the state of the garage, and asks Michael to have it refurbished, but he finds the cost of a contractor too expensive, so takes on the job himself.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Michael bumps into a high-school friend who is a keen weightlifter and asks him for help getting back in shape.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Franklin and Kady plant some seeds in the ground to symbolise their growing affection, while Jay tells Michael that their love life will improve if they are celibate for six months.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Junior submits a cartoon in a competition and wins first prize, so Michael takes him to meet TV executives to try to get his talent noticed. Meanwhile, Claire threatens to break up with Tony unless he can bring something fresh into their relationship.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: High Court enforcement officers Paul Bohill and Steve and Ben Pinner face their biggest eviction yet - taking on squatters in a large central London office block. With the help of the police, they try to remove a suspected group of 70 from the building, but with a barricade in place, the team faces a challenging operation ahead. Elsewhere, officers are confronted by an army of family and friends when they attempt to enforce a writ at the property of a debtor, and face a difficult eviction at the north London home of a heavily pregnant tenant and her family, after the council fails to pay the rent to the landlord.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Agents Stewart McCracken and Elmore Victor head to Liverpool for what they expect to be a routine repossession, but instead face the most challenging eviction of their careers. Behind the front door, they find a critically ill two-year-old child with major heart problems, who is on constant life support and unable to breathe without a ventilator. Meanwhile, Brian O'Shaughnessy and Del Anglin chase £2,000 worth of debt owed by a business based in Kent, and recover £4,000 from a recycling business in Buckinghamshire. Plus, Stewart and Elmore encounter another family in crisis in Birmingham, where a retired couple who acted as guarantor for their daughter's tenancy are liable to pay over £3,000 after she defaulted.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.sub-title: Can't Pay Special: Big Family Bust Up.
programme.desc: One-off edition in which the High Court enforcement agents are caught in the crossfire of three bitter family disputes, including a debt-dodging man who pushes his panic-stricken mother over the edge. Plus, a family booted onto the streets at night by a ruthless aunt, and a man who won't engage with the agents and loses his car.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.sub-title: Can't Pay Special: Secrets and Lies.
programme.desc: Paul and Steve have an emotional confrontation in Berkshire when a tearful woman accuses her landlord of fleecing her for extra rent, while Brian and Del travel to Luton to recover £4,500 owed by an elusive debtor who has been giving them the runaround.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on people on benefits in the West Midlands. They include single mum-of-five Emma, who needs income support to help feed her children - but cannot afford their school uniforms - and 29-year-old Antonio, whose on-off work pattern has left him in debt, prompting him to seek help from his local MP to keep a roof over his head. Former Asbo kid Danny, now 21, is trying to put his criminal past behind him, and 59-year-old Teresa, just a few weeks off retirement, has been deemed unfit to work by her doctor - but the benefits office does not agree.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on the experiences of welfare claimants in relationships. They include Essex couple Suzanne and Derek, who are looking to move to avoid paying bedroom tax on their four-bedroom home. But finding a property to meet Suzanne's exacting standards is proving tricky. Meanwhile, epilepsy sufferer Stephan and his wife Linda are deep in debt but still spend £12 a week feeding the homeless, and Carl and Angie's benefits are affected by his disability allowance and her wages from a part-time job.(n)

programme.title: Rich House, Poor House
programme.desc: Families from opposite ends of the wealth and class divide swap homes, budgets and social status for seven days to discover how the other half lives. The Bentleys from Lincolnshire trade places with the Carter-Begbie family from Stamford. The Bentleys rank in the top 10 per cent of Britain's wealthy, and live in a large four-bedroom house with three bathrooms, two reception rooms, a top-of-the-range kitchen, conservatory and games room. The Carter-Begbies live in a rented three-bedroom house and have a weekly budget of £140. This week, however, that will rise to almost £1,800.(n)

programme.title: Don't Tell the Doctor
programme.desc: A bride-to-be addicted to diet pills, a tanning addict who is injecting himself with an unlicensed tanning drug he buys off the internet and a man suffering panic attacks.(n)

programme.title: Shannon Matthews: The Mother's Story
programme.desc: The disappearance of nine-year-old Shannon Matthews in 2008 gripped the nation. Her mother Karen claimed that her daughter had gone missing on her way home from school, prompting a nationwide search. But weeks later, it was revealed that Karen had known the truth all along - Shannon was being kept hidden by a man known to her mother, who had plotted to claim the £50,000 reward money for her return. This documentary tries to get at the truth of a woman many have branded as evil, asking what drove her to do it, how she can rebuild her life and whether she is sorry for her actions.(n)

programme.title: Emerald City
programme.desc: As the Wizard arrives in the Kingdom of Ev, Dorothy and Lucas find themselves on opposite sides. Meanwhile, the Witch of the West raises an army to take on the Wizard.(n)

programme.title: American Horror Story
programme.sub-title: American Horror Story: Asylum: Dark Cousin.
programme.desc: One of Briarcliff's residents summons a dark angel to the manor, and the evil presence has even the possessed Sister Mary Eunice terrified. Meanwhile, Kit makes a bold move to be reunited with Grace, and Sister Jude discovers she can no longer run from her past. Psychological horror, starring Lily Rabe.(n)

programme.title: Top 20 Funniest
programme.desc: A countdown of the funniest video clips in America, from those that went viral to home movies, pranks, surveillance footage and news bloopers.(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Leo is rushed to hospital after Fez loses control of Hyde's car during a driving lesson, and falls in love with nurse Kitty. Meanwhile, Kelso takes a job as a department store model, much to Jackie's dismay.(n)

Animated adventure, with the voices of Justin Long, Hayden Panettiere and Dennis Hopper.(n)

programme.title: That's My Boy
programme.desc: A teenager fathers a child and raises him alone, but when the boy grows up, he no longer wants anything to do with his drunken, irresponsible parent. As he prepares to get married, the son finds his father gatecrashing the wedding, desperate to rebuild their relationship but just as obnoxious as ever. Comedy, starring Adam Sandler and Andy Samberg.(n)

programme.title: The Incredible Hulk
programme.desc: Doses of radiation turn a mild-mannered scientist into an angry, uncontrollable monstrosity in this adaptation of the Marvel Comics series. Lou Ferrigno, who played the Hulk in the 1970s TV series, has a cameo as a security guard and provides the voice of the Hulk(n)

programme.title: Reindeer Games
programme.desc: Ben Affleck stars in John Frankenheimer's film as Rudy Duncan, an incarcerated small-time crook who takes on his murdered cellmate's identity when he is released from jail. Using his new identity he manages to sleep with the ex-con's raunchy penpal, but things get more dangerous as her brother, thinking Rudy is a master criminal, attempts to recruit him in a major casino heist(n)

programme.title: Starring Adam West
programme.desc: Actor Adam West is profiled(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn
programme.desc: A meek young woman emigrates from Ireland to New York City in the 1950s, and finds her heart torn between a magnetic Italian suitor and a charming lad back home in this nostalgic and moving romance(n)

programme.title: Dragonfly
programme.desc: Kevin Costner gives a sensitive performance in this intriguing thriller about a doctor who tries to communicate with his dead spouse. After his wife dies while on a Red Cross mission, a man (Costner) is plagued by what he believes are messages from her, and tries to decipher what they mean. Kathy Bates, Joe Morton, Ron Rifkin, Linda Hunt, Susanna Thompson, Jacob Vargas(n)

programme.title: Magic Mike XXL
programme.desc: Retired male stripper Magic Mike (Channing Tatum) decides to help his friends put on one last show, as the crew embark on a road trip to Myrtle Beach to perform at an exotic-dance convention. Along the way, they brighten the lives of several women, including an aspiring photographer (Amber Heard) and a diva (Jada Pinkett Smith) from Mike's past(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring
programme.desc: Paranormal investigators battle a malevolent entity that's haunting a family in a remote farmhouse(n)

programme.title: Scream 3
programme.desc: Wes Craven's Scream (1996) was a half-parody/half-tribute to the first wave of slasher films of the 1970s and 1980s, and since most of them spawned a large number of sequels, it's only appropriate that Craven and screenwriter Kevin Williamson produced a third installment of their Scream franchise. Sidney Prescott (Neve Campbell), traumatized by the brutal murders of her friends, has left her hometown of Woodsboro and is working in California as a crisis intervention counselor. Meanwhile, "Stab," the novel by Gale Weathers (Courtney Cox Arquette), is spawning a series of successful horror films, and as Stab 3: Return to Woodsboro is being filmed in Los Angeles, a lunatic has gotten his hands on a copy of the script, and is murdering the characters in the same order that they die in the movie. But predicting who will die next is not as simple as it might seem, since the producers have circulated three different screenplays, with different endings. In addition to Campbell and Cox-Arquette, David Arquette returns from the first two films as less-than-bright "Dewey" Riley; new members of the cast include Parker Posey, Patrick Dempsey, Scott Foley, and Jenny McCarthy. Kevin Williamson wrote the original story, but the screenplay was penned by Ehren Kruger(n)

programme.title: The Astronaut's Wife
programme.desc: After an accident in space, an astronaut's pregnant wife suspects he is no longer the same man(n)

programme.title: Wonderland
programme.desc: Val Kilmer stars as John Holmes, legendary porn star of huge talent but who, in the 80s, was out of films and into drugs. He falls in with gangster Eddie Nash (Eric Bogosian) who believes Holmes told a bunch of drugs dealers about his wealth and robbed him. Four are found beaten to death, the survivor incriminates Holmes but at trial, he's acquitted, although ex-wife Lisa Kudrow isn't so sure. James Cox's film, told in different time frames and almost from a Rashomon point of view, is a glimpse of the Los Angeles nightmare, where not everybody is a tooth-whitened Hollywood star(n)

programme.title: Wall Street
programme.desc: (1987) Oliver Stone's morality tale stars Charlie Sheen as Bud Fox, an ambitious young stockbroker, who's willing to do whatever it takes to emulate his hero, supremely wealthy financier Gordon Gekko (Michael Douglas). Bud's initial attempts to play the market honestly don't light his touchpaper to success. But, when he passes on some insider information to Gekko, his career starts to pick up pace and, as he becomes increasingly embroiled in illegal trading and financial espionage, he begins to make the money of his dreams. However, he fails to fully comprehend the true cost of his deals until one of them threatens the livelihood of his union boss father (Martin Sheen). Also starring Daryl Hannah and Terence Stamp. M,W,R(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: Futuristic science fiction thriller, about a detective who works for a police department that uses three infallible psychics to help convict murderers before they have actually committed their crimes. When the detective discovers that he has been identified as a future killer, he becomes a fugitive from his own colleagues. Based on a short story by Philip K Dick. Starring Tom Cruise, Colin Farrell, Samantha Morton, Max von Sydow, Steve Harris, Neal McDonough(n)

programme.title: Stuck on You
programme.desc: Comedy about conjoined twins whose bond is tested when one of them decides to become an actor in Hollywood(n)

programme.title: Cheech and Chong's Next Movie
programme.desc: Richard Marin and Thomas Chong's misadventures as bumbling musicians(n)

programme.title: I Spy
programme.desc: Eddie Murphy stars in a comedy remake of the 1960s spy series of the same name. A CIA agent teams up with a boxer for a secret mission to recover a super-plane from Budapest(n)

programme.title: Screwed
programme.desc: Scott Alexander and Larry Karaszewski, who scripted "Ed Wood" and "Man on the Moon," co-directed and co-wrote this frenetic farce about a chauffeur (Norm Macdonald) who steers into big trouble when he kidnaps the pooch of his wealthy, tyrannical boss (Elaine Stritch). Danny DeVito, Dave Chappelle, Daniel Benzali, Sherman Hemsley, Sarah Silverman, Malcolm Stewart(n)

programme.title: The Darkness
programme.desc: A boy stumbles upon an ancient Native American burial ground during a family trip to the Grand Canyon in this skin-crawling tale of terror. He takes five sacred stones from there back home, unaware that they contain a malevolent supernatural force(n)

programme.title: The Cotton Club
programme.desc: A musician works with mobsters to advance his career but falls in love with the girlfriend of a gangland kingpin(n)

programme.title: Thirteen Conversations About One Thing
programme.desc: Following up on her acclaimed debut, Clockwatchers, Jill Sprecher spins this intricate ensemble film about life's big questions. Set in New York City, the film focuses on five different characters with radically different perspectives on life. Gene (Alan Arkin) manages a large insurance company and is a compulsive pessimist, constantly bursting the bubbles of his more cheery colleagues. Walker (John Turturro), who holds a similarly bleak view of the world, decides that he cannot stand another day in his dull life as a physics professor and thus promptly dumps his wife, Patricia (Amy Irving). Troy (Matthew McConaughey) is an up-and-coming lawyer whose career is derailed after a hit-and-run accident. And Beatrice (Clea DuVall) is a modest cleaning woman hoping for a miracle. This film was screened at the 2001 Toronto Film Festival(n)

Forensic drama, starring Hill Harper.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac examines the death of a Base jumper seemingly killed when he hit a flock of pigeons, and discovers the victim was in a witness protection programme. Meanwhile, Stella looks into the case of a wealthy man found dead in his car on the day of his daughter's 16th birthday party - and Lindsay is bitten by a cobra at the scene of the crime. Drama, starring Gary Sinise and Melina Kanakaredes.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY

Meanwhile, Stella and Danny answer a call reporting a body found in a peep-show booth. Gary Sinise and Hill Harper star.(n)

programme.desc: An ageing actress grows desperate to recapture her glory days and resorts to murdering her husband and making it look like suicide. She hopes the publicity will revive her flagging Broadway career, but she reckons without Columbo's uncanny ability to see through her devious performance. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Janet Leigh, Sam Jaffe and John Payne.(n)

The killer makes the murder look like a random mugging, but he is not as clever as he thinks and the crumpled cop soon begins to pick up on the trail of clues he has left behind. Crime drama, directed by and starring Patrick McGoohan, with Peter Falk and Leslie Nielsen.(n)

programme.desc: The owner of a shipbuilding business disapproves of his son's plans for the company, and announces his intention to sell up. However, that night, he is murdered and his body dumped at sea. The crumpled cop, joined by two sidekicks, becomes convinced the victim's son is responsible - but everything is not as it seems. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk and Robert Vaughn, directed by Patrick McGoohan.(n)

programme.desc: The funeral of a special agent in Los Angeles leads Shepard on a dangerous covert mission to finish some classified business she began a decade previously in Europe. Feature-length edition of the crime drama, starring Lauren Holly, Cote de Pablo and Sean Murray.(n)

programme.desc: The murder of a port authority officer reveals Parsa's possible whereabouts as the team continues the hunt for the terrorist intent on wiping out NCIS. programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. programme.title: Reefer Madness
programme.desc: The made-for-cable musical satire Reefer Madness is based on the award-winning play of the same name, which in turn was inspired by the notorious -- and deliciously awful -- 1936 anti-marijuana film originally titled Tell Your Children. A smarmy lecturer (Alan Cumming in the first of his three roles in the film) arrives in a typical small town of the late '30s to warn the populace of the dangers of the "evil weed," bringing along a lurid propaganda film to dramatize his message. In broad, unsubtle, and hilarious strokes, the movie-within-a-movie shows how even a squeaky-clean pair of highschoolers named Mary Lane (Kristen Bell) and Jimmy Harper (Christian Campbell) can become hopeless dope addicts by succumbing to the lure of marijuana. Reefer Madness is not only a savage skewering of the original black-and-white movie (some of the musical's campiest lines are taken directly from the earlier script!), but also a devastating attack on what playwrights Kevin Murphy and Dan Studney consider to be the real reason that the 1936 movie was made: to frighten the public out of their wits in order to keep them under the thumb of an oppressive government. Thus, the musical manages to take a number of not-so-veiled swipes at xenophobia, racism, McCarthyism, the Bush Administration's Homeland Security policy, and even the recent FCC clampdown on "offensive" TV fare (one of the film's highlights is a garish nightclub number featuring Jesus Christ). The ebulliently staged songs include "The Stuff," "Down at the Ol' Five and Dime," "Lonely Pew," "Listen to Jesus Jimmy," "Mary Jane/Mary Lane," "The Brownie Song," "Tell 'Em the Truth," and the title number. Officially titled Reefer Madness: The Movie Musical, this film first aired April 16, 2005, on the Showtime cable service(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: Brett Ratner's martial-arts action-comedy sequel starring Chris Tucker and Jackie Chan. When the Chinese Ambassador to the US is shot while in the act of divulging the whereabouts of a major Triad leader, the American authorities once more send Chief Inspector Lee and Detective James Carter into the fray. Lee quickly corners the would-be assassin, Kenji, but the shock of coming face-to-face with an old friend gives the baddie just enough time to escape. Kenji's trail leads the mismatched cops to Paris, where car chases and a sequence among the under-dressed dancers of the Folies Bergère await them, plus rather a lot of dodgy French stereotypes and a finale atop the Eiffel Tower(n)

programme.title: Maximum Overdrive
programme.desc: The Rhea-M comet starts revolving round earth and provokes all machinery to become their own masters and revolt against mankind. The Rhea-M comet starts revolving round earth and provokes all machinery to become their own masters and revolt against mankind. A group of people find shelter in a relay station and are surrounded by a horde of raging trucks. After a tremendous fight. Bill, Bubba, Brett and some others manage to reach the coast and set sail to an island void of technology(n)

programme.title: Furious 7
programme.desc: Tight-knit gang of street racers battle a new nemesis and rescue a software genius from terrorists(n)

programme.title: Death Race
programme.desc: Writer-director Paul W.S. Anderson's turbo-charged, slam-bang tune-up of Roger Corman's 1975 cult vehicle "Death Race 2000" follows the non-stop action taking place during a do-or-die contest pitting a convict (Jason Statham) against other cons, with the winner walking off with his freedom. Anderson admits to being "a big fan of the Corman movie," and this reworking is a glowing salute to Corman's original. Corman also serves as one of the film's producers, along with Anderson and Tom Cruise(n)

programme.title: The Transporter
programme.desc: Frank Martin will transport everything - for a price. Ice cool under pressure and a brilliant driver, he makes only one mistake: opening a wriggling package to reveal a kidnapped Chinese girl(n)

programme.title: The Strangers
programme.desc: A suburban couple returning to their semi-secluded house after attending a wedding finds their lives suddenly thrown into chaos with the arrival of three malevolent, masked strangers in director Bryan Bertino's tense tale of survival. Liv Tyler and Scott Speedman star as the couple forced to resort to violence they never thought themselves capable of as they struggle for their lives, and model-turned-actress Gemma Ward continues her transition from the catwalk to the silver screen as one of the merciless masked invaders(n)

programme.title: Friday Night Lights
programme.desc: H.G. Bissinger's best-selling true-life account of a few months in the life of a high-school football team comes to the screen in this adaptation written and directed by Peter Berg. Odessa, TX, is an oil town in the western part of the state that's home to the Permian High School Panthers, the football team with the best winning record in the state. Odessa is a town with more than its share of problems; the decline of the oil business in Texas has set the city's economy into a tailspin, and racial tensions still erupt into violence on occasion. But football is the one thing that brings all the people of Odessa together, and on Friday nights every fall, as many as 20,000 people fill Permian's football stadium to watch Coach Gary Gaines (Billy Bob Thornton) and his boys try to lead the team to victory. As Gaines works to build a winning team in a town where victory is prized above all else, however, his players struggle through the emotional trials common to any teenager and ponder the fact that there is little future in their hometown...and that a championship season can be as much a burden as a triumph. Friday Night Lights also stars Lucas Black, Derek Luke, Jay Hernandez, and country singer-turned-actor Tim McGraw(n)

programme.title: Bean

programme.title: Raising Arizona

Written and directed by Paul Feig(n)

programme.desc: Born in an Alley. A dog and her puppies struggle to live after an alley delivery; a dog dies from dehydration, sparking a criminal investigation; and an injured bird finds an advocate for care in an animal medical technician(n)

programme.desc: Deadly Diet. An investigator confronts an owner about her starving dogs, a puppy with a broken leg is rescued from a murder scene and the owner of an aggressive Great Dane hopes it can find an adoptive home(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops: Phoenix
programme.desc: Cop Cat. Twelve cats are rescued from a hoarder's house; six dogs are seized from a house after their owner is evicted; and a feral cat with an injured paw is saved and finds a home in the Gilbert Police Department(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Bournemouth v Chelsea at the Vitality Stadium and Manchester City v Hull City at the Etihad Stadium. The Cherries were aiming to avoid being dragged into the battle to avoid the drop, but had their work cut out against the champions-elect.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: Round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs, and leafing through the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 9.00.(n)

programme.title: The Big Questions
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell presents a discussion from Netherhall School, Cambridge of gender-neutral language, trading with countries that abuse human rights, and the meaning of Easter.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Helen and Simon Holroyd sample life in Australia for a week to find out if a move there might help save their relationship, which is under strain from Simon's heavy work schedule. Nicki Chapman presents.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Tim Wonnacott travels to Oswestry Showground, Shropshire, where two teams of dancers compete to seek out the best bargains and sell their discoveries for a profit at auction. Christina Trevanion and Kate Bliss are on hand to offer expert advice on the choice buys.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore a terrace in Carlisle in Cumbria, a detached house in Long Eton, Nottinghamshire, and a flat in London's East Ham.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile Spring Diaries
programme.desc: Giving toads a helping hand to reach their natural habitat, Cumbrian communities' work to recover from the winter floods, and Paul Martin's tips on building a watery wildlife haven.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: The team travels to Winchester, where Christina Trevanion and James Lewis join Paul Martin to value items brought in by the public, including a brooch, Etruscan pottery and a maritime journal. Paul also visits the Winchester School of Arts.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah is on the Dorset coast with a couple hoping to find literary inspiration and seaside serenity for their £500,000 budget. She also meets a pair of inspired printmakers.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Josie D'Arby visits a farm in the Yorkshire Dales during lambing season, and the Archbishop of York meets a woman who forgave those responsible for her son's death.(n)

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin and the team continue to explore the archipelago, much of which still remains a mystery to science. The presenter ventures far beneath the waves in a deep-sea submersible in search of an elusive ocean giant, the mola or sunfish, to understand more about its little-known behaviour. She also sees how sea lions have been affected by the El Nino weather phenomenon, before the team sails north for the most remote and inhospitable islands in the Galapagos - Wolf and Darwin, where Liz helps tag and track hammerhead sharks that school at this location.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: The team are in Holderness in the east Riding of Yorkshire, where Matt Baker and Anita Rani visit Spurn Island, an area separated from the mainland by the storm surge of 2013. Matt meets a lifeboat crew, while Anita goes in search of the island's wildlife. John Craven meets a photographer documenting farming communities on Sunk Island, while Adam Henson and Tom Heap report on dairy farming.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Pembroke Castle in South Wales, where objects brought in to be valued include a collection of intimate photographs charting the last days of the imprisoned Russian royal family in 1917, and a stick pin presented to one of George V's servants. A dairy maid demonstrates how to use a butter maker with a connection to Queen Victoria.(n)

programme.title: Line of Duty
programme.desc: Kate is approached by another woman who claims to have been assaulted by Michael Farmer. Combined with the new forensic evidence casting doubt over Tim Ifield, the revelation threatens to undermine AC-12 team's case, to Steve's fury. However, it gives Kate the opportunity to ingratiate herself further with the officers of Operation Trapdoor. Steve challenges Roz's husband to vouch for her whereabouts on the night Tim Ifield disappeared, and sees a new direction for the investigation when he proves evasive.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the latest Premier League action, featuring Sunderland v Manchester United at the Stadium of Light and Everton v Leicester City at Goodison Park. Sunderland have been at their best in the final months of the season in recent years, and need to be once again if they are to pull off an impressive escape from the relegation places.(n)

programme.title: I'm Different: Let Me Drive
programme.desc: The stories of two learner drivers on the autistic spectrum. Chris from Bournemouth has Asperger's syndrome, and wants to be able to drive so he can spend more time with his girlfriend - but he fears unpredictable situations, which makes him overly cautious behind the wheel. London resident Cannadine finds it hard maintaining concentration.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: New series. Ben Fogle and Kate Humble go behind the scenes at Longleat Safari Park once again, meeting the osteopath helping to treat the arthritis of a rescued circus elephant.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Dion Dublin and Martin Roberts explore a terraced house in Burnley, a detached property in Liverpool and a bungalow in Derby.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Lawrence puts the squeeze on a finance company that has not paid its rent, while officers visit an airline that has failed to pay compensation to a passenger for delays.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: The imitation sunglasses that could seriously harm your health and the counterfeit brake pads that could cost lives. Presented by Matt Allwright.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Gary Pe and Danny Sebastian help two teams of best friends search for items at the Westpoint Arena in Exeter, while presenter Natasha Raskin oversees proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Part one of two. Karl gets his test results from Jimmi, while Daniel presents a challenge to Zara, and Rob has to deal with a family issue that could turn into a drugs bust.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: IT workers Matt and Paul return to continue their bid to crack the three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. Matt Allwright hosts, with help from Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple with a budget of £450,000 to look for a home in rural Somerset, and also views destruction caused by recent flooding.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore reclaims three items from a Walsall recycling centre, with woodworker Norman Wilkinson rejuvenating a sewing machine and audio tech Horse restoring a record player.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Elizabeth Talbot and Philip Serrell head to Layer Marney Tower in rural Essex to find interesting items that might fetch a profit at auction. A book and a terracotta vase are among the objects catching the antiques experts' eyes, while presenter Paul Martin walks along Southend Pier.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Conservative Party.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Michelle Ackerley present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright exposes the trade in fire blankets the manufacturers have made fraudulent safety claims about, as well as reporting on fake tattoo inks that could be lethal and counterfeit operations being run in spare rooms and garages around the UK.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Carmel attempts to build bridges with Stacey, but she is less than forgiving and refuses to let her see Arthur - so Max intervenes on Carmel's behalf. Steven is unimpressed when Lauren arranges another girls' night out, Michelle confides in Sharon after an awkward shift at the cafe with Bex, and Ben and Jay enjoy the company of their temporary guests.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Car Share
programme.desc: It's John's grandmother's birthday, but he has completely forgotten to post her card. Will he be able to put things right on the journey to work? Comedy about the daily commute of supermarket employees John Redmond and Kayleigh Kitson, who have been thrown together in a company car share scheme, with each trip bringing fresh insight into their lives, as well as twists and turns in their unlikely relationship. Co-written by and starring Peter Kay and Sian Gibson, with Danny Swarsbrick.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Car Share
programme.desc: With a lot preying on her mind, the last thing Kayleigh needs is to find herself given the task of promoting national blackcurrant jam week. Fortunately, her car-sharing colleague John is on hand to encourage her with plenty of unwanted advice. Wry comedy, co-written by and starring Peter Kay and Sian Gibson. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: All Round to Mrs Brown's
programme.desc: Actor-turned-documentarian Ross Kemp joins Agnes in her studio lounge, where his survival skills are put to the test. Chef Aly whips up another culinary storm as comedian Kevin Bridges - and his mother Patricia - join him in the kitchen for another installment of The Cathy Brown Show, and wildlife expert Steve Backshall may have cause to regret joining Dermot and Buster's Celebrity Safari. Plus, another Thought for the Day from Father Damien and Father Trevor, and Pixie Lott closes the show, performing her new song Baby.(n)

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: New series. Just a month following the end of his last run, the diminutive Irishman returns with a brand now run of 13 shows. Here, Graham catches up with Michael Caine and Morgan Freeman, stars of new heist comedy Going in Style. Plus, comedian Jack Whitehall and Game of Thrones actress Gemma Whelan talk about their roles in BBC One's Evelyn Waugh adaptation, Decline and Fall. The nation's favourite man band Take That feature, while Graham also subjects more audience members to the dreaded red chair - so their stories had better be good.(n)

programme.title: An Island Parish
programme.sub-title: The Times They Are a Changing.
programme.desc: Rosie Guille organises a visit from a group of respected artists to capture the beauty of the island and highlight conservation issues. Methodist lay preacher Karen Le Mouton has dedicated the past three years of her life to the people of Sark, but she and her congregation must come to terms with the idea she may have to leave to begin ordination training.(n)

programme.title: The Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter is keen to find out how hardy the plants are that she deliberately left in the ground last year to test their resilience over the winter months. She also visits a retired doctor who has created a fascinating topiary garden in Monymusk. George Anderson takes a look at his winter stem border that's now full of plants, the glasshouse is a hive of activity as Jim McColl continues to sow, and Chris Beardshaw works on the pond area, planting a range of grasses on the banking.(n)

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: The horticultural tour continues with a trip to South Africa, one of the greenest zones in the world. In Cape Town, Monty Don visits the renowned Kirstenbosch Botanic Gardens, where he encounters the country's national plant, the king protea, and discovers an abundance of plant life in the Drakensberg mountains.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don offers advice on the best apples and pears to grow in small spaces when he begins to plant up his new fruit garden and gets on with planning for colour when he adds some summer flowering bulbs. As April gets underway, Carol Klein chooses the primrose as her plant of the month and the programme meets a couple from Yorkshire who have a passion for growing fruit and have filled their garden with over 100 fruit trees. As part of the programme's 50th anniversary, Joe Swift makes the case for his Golden Jubilee plant, the one he thinks has had the most impact on British gardens over the last half-century.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Reports on the UK's forests. Matt Baker helps out with an inventory of the New Forest's trees, and Ellie Harrison visits Inverness to take a look at industrial timber production and the impact of forestry on red squirrels. Sean Fletcher reports on the Scottish tradition of hutting, John Craven examines the revival of working with horses in forests, and Charlotte Smith discovers whether enough trees are being planted in Britain.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Triathlon
programme.sub-title: Triathlon World Series Highlights: 2017 ITU World Triathlon Series: Gold Coast.
programme.desc: Action from the second round of the ITU World Triathlon Series from Gold Coast in Australia, featuring the men's and women's races.(n)

programme.title: MOTD2 Extra
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents football discussion with a line-up of guests, focusing on the headlines from yesterday's matches and news ahead of today's fixtures.(n)

programme.title: Morecambe & Wise in Pieces
programme.sub-title: Morecambe and Wise in Pieces: The Sketches.
programme.desc: Penelope Keith presents another edition of the occasional series, this time trawling the archives for the best of Eric Morecambe and Ernie Wise's bite-sized routines from their shows.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Neil Oliver explores the strong bonds between Great Britain and Denmark, starting at the very tip of Jutland where the North Sea meets the Baltic. Nicholas Crane investigates how after defeats in the Napoleonic wars and the loss of lucrative farming land the Danish put poor soil to work rearing pork, and made a big business out of exporting bacon. Plus, a retired man takes on the tough challenge of the North Sea Beach Marathon.(n)

programme.title: Ice Station Zebra
programme.desc: An American atomic submarine commander races against time to reach a Soviet spy satellite that has crash-landed near a British research station in the Arctic - before Russian troops arrive to stake their claim to it. Adventure based on Alistair MacLean's novel, starring Rock Hudson, Ernest Borgnine, Jim Brown, Tony Bill and Patrick McGoohan.(n)

programme.title: Earth's Greatest Spectacles
programme.desc: The north-eastern region of the United States, known as New England, is the stage for one of the most incredible colour changes on the planet when the vivid greens of summer give way to the golds and reds of autumn. This film reveals how this vibrant fiesta is created by the battles between the trees and the forests inhabitants. Moose, chipmunks, rattlesnakes and a bizarre mixture of caterpillars all play a crucial role; but surprisingly the forest itself was made to be so colourful, thanks to a combination of hard work by beavers, ants and humans. Narrated by Domhnall Gleeson.(n)

programme.title: The House That £100K Built
programme.desc: Retired couple Derek and Christine from Huddersfield attempt to build their first house from scratch in the south-east of England. However, the development does not go according to plan when the unthinkable happens, and they receive word that the house may have been built in the wrong place.(n)

programme.title: Golf: The Masters
programme.sub-title: Golf: The Masters Live: 2017 Day Four.
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces coverage of the fourth day from the Augusta National in Georgia, as the opening Major of the year concludes. Holder Jordan Spieth of America held the lead going into this stage in 2016, but England's Danny Willett came back from five shots down at the start of the final day last year, carding an impressive five-under-par 67 to win his maiden Major. Spieth eventually finished in second place alongside Willett's compatriot Lee Westwood on a day that was also notable for Shane Lowry, Davis Love III, and Louis Oosthuizen all making holes-in-one on the 16th. With commentary by Peter Alliss, Ken Brown, Paul Azinger and Andrew Cotter.(n)

programme.title: The Tempest
programme.desc: A noblewoman with magical powers is banished to a remote island along with her daughter. She uses her abilities to dominate the mystical creatures living there and summons a storm that wrecks a ship. When the survivors come ashore, she learns one of them is her brother, who exiled her, and plans revenge. Shakespearean fantasy, starring Helen Mirren, Felicity Jones, Djimon Hounsou and Chris Cooper.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs the debate from Gillingham in Kent, where the panel comprises Conservative MP Suella Fernandes, Shadow Home Secretary Diane Abbott, Liberal Democrat leader Tim Farron, co-leader of the Green Party Jonathan Bartley, businesswoman and broadcaster Michelle Dewberry, and West Midlands Secretary of the Unite union Gerard Coyne.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.sub-title: It's Only Love If It Hurts.
programme.desc: Serena faces her demons and comes to a heart-wrenching conclusion. Meanwhile, Zosia takes action when Isaac reveals his true colours, and Mo risks her professional reputation when she goes the extra mile.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The team gives advice on items connected to the British Empire, and presenter Paul Martin visits HMS Victory in Portsmouth.(n)

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Tommy and Craig attempt to recover more than £10,000 owed to a couple who bought a boat that turned out to be a wreck. Lawrence and Kev encounter some seriously heavy goods.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: A broken Ercol coffee table requires extreme expertise to redeem it, while artisan bag maker Neil Wragg has to use all of his creativity to rethink an old bicycle.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Burton Constable Hall near Hull, which is home to a collection of treasures. Objects brought in to be valued include a ship's anchor that was found in a garden pond, a medal awarded to sailor for helping to recover Captain Scott's ship from the Antarctic in 1901, some 17th-century flat pack furniture, and a flimsy booklet that proved to be a profitable investment.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Conversations
programme.desc: Sean Curran talks to former Labour party leader Neil Kinnock about his life and political career. First shown on BBC Parliament on 23 July. Postponed from April 5.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.sub-title: Whitstable to the Isle of Wight.
programme.desc: Alice Roberts heads for Dover, where she learns how to pilot a hovercraft and discovers the science behind its operation in an experiment involving kitchen scales and a hair dryer.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: Len takes Jasper Carrott back to Barry Island in south Wales, where the comedian reminisces about a childhood holiday he had there in 1958.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Actress Sheridan Smith, who went from singing with her parents in the working men's clubs near their North Lincolnshire home to successful stage performances in Little Shop of Horrors and Legally Blonde - not to mention her countless TV appearances - embarks on a journey to find out where her family's musical talents come from. She is soon hot on the trail of her great-great-grandfather Benjamin Doubleday, a world-class banjo player and musical impresario - but she is surprised by his change in fortunes.(n)

programme.title: More Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: An emergency Caesarean on a cow leads to a worrying case for farm vet Graham, and Ian performs a dangerous operation on a rescue dog with painful ears. At a small animal hospital in Fife, a local celebrity - the town peacock - puts the pressure on vet Adam. Narrated by Felicity Kendal. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Natural World: Empire of the Desert Ants.
programme.desc: Documentary filmed in Arizona, following a honey ant queen's rise to dominance and the methods it uses to extend its influence and keep its subjects under control, including cannibalism, genocide, the ruthless elimination of rivals and the sacrifice of thousands. Narrated by Andy Serkis.(n)

programme.title: Attenborough and the Giant Egg
programme.desc: David Attenborough returns to Madagascar to see how the island has changed in the 50 years since his first visit, and to search for more clues about one of his most treasured possessions, the egg of an elephant bird, an ostrich-like creature that weighed half a ton. Scientists perform tests to determine the age of the egg, as the naturalist discovers whether the bird's extinction can shed light on what is happening on the island today.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Christina Trevanion and Thomas Plant set off for their last leg from Gwersyllt, near Wrexham. After meandering through the border counties of north Wales and England, the pair finish up at their final auction in Stoke-on-Trent.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The experts take on the challenges of restoring three cherished family heirlooms, bringing back to life a Victorian cuckoo clock, a 1970s bowl and a 200-year-old sea chest.(n)

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches Colorado, where he follows in the footsteps of 19th-century east coast men who came to experience the cowboy life. At Bent's Old Fort, he is transported back to the Mexican American War of 1848 and finds himself inspecting the troops, before heading out into the spectacular gorge of the Arkansas River aboard the historic narrow gauge Royal Gorge Railroad.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: Jeremy Paxman asks the questions as the competition reaches its climax, with Wolfson College, Cambridge, battling it out in the final against either Edinburgh or Balliol College, Oxford, for the right to lift the trophy designed by Manchester sculptor Adrian Moakes. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland
programme.sub-title: In Search of the Real Scotland.
programme.desc: Paul Murton boards the Jacobite steam train to make one of the world's most famous railways journeys, with his route starting at the foot of Ben Nevis in Fort William and continuing along to Mallaig and onwards to the Isle of Skye. For centuries, outsiders had seldom visited the beautiful landscape of the west coast, but then the power of steam changed everything and within a century, a network of railways spread across the entire country, connecting the industrial cities of the south to the mountains and glens of the north.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Monica Galetti work at Giraffe Manor in Kenya, a unique hotel where giraffe, staff and guests co-exist in a 1930s Scottish-style hunting lodge on the edge of Nairobi National Park. The pair travel to the remote but luxurious outpost of Sasaab Lodge, a six-acre plot set within 82,000 acres of land owned by Samburu tribespeople, who receive a fee for every guest that stays and make up 75 per cent of the staff.(n)

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Comedian and actor Chris Addison, broadcaster Sara Cox, comedian Sue Perkins and regular panellist Alan Davies are invited by Stephen Fry to consider misconceptions. As usual, the host awards points for the answers he considers most interesting, regardless of whether or not they are correct.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Second Chance Summer: Tuscany
programme.desc: New series. Series following 10 strangers at turning points in their lives who are brought together to take over an Italian farm in the foothills of Mount Amiata, adjusting to the challenges of communal living in another country. In the first episode, they face the difficult tasks of bringing in a harvest of Merlot grapes and keeping the local wild boar at bay.(n)

programme.title: Britain at War: Imperial War Museums at 100
programme.desc: Falklands War veteran and charity campaigner Simon Weston marks 100 years since the establishment of the Imperial War Museums, which were initially set up in 1917 - in the midst of the First World War - to pay tribute to civil and military sacrifices during times of conflict. First housed at the Crystal Palace in London, over the past century, the organisation has expanded, comprising five sites across Britain. In this programme Weston examines 10 key objects from the IWM's collection, with help from special `advocates' who explore each artefact's story. Includes contributions by Bear Grylls, Al Murray, Cornelia Parker, Steve McQueen, Kate Adie, Kelly Holmes and Anita Rani.(n)

programme.title: Teenage Tommies
programme.desc: Fergal Keane explores some of the most powerful stories of Britain's boy soldiers, with as many as 250,000 under-18s having served in the British Army during the First World War and every 10th volunteer lying about his age. The journalist examines what made them enlist and finds out how they coped with the reality of war, and looks at how there was a movement in Britain to get them home as casualties began to mount. He also meets the children and grandchildren of veterans, taking them on an emotional journey to the places where their ancestors trained and fought.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: The work of scientists trying to understand why the world's weather seems to be getting more extreme and if these patterns are a taste of what is to come. In the past few years, the UK has experienced very cold winters, drought and floods, while in Texas an unprecedented amount of rainfall has been followed by a record-breaking dry period.(n)

programme.title: Folk Awards 2017: Highlights
programme.desc: Performances and memorable moments from the folk music event, hosted by Mark Radcliffe and Julie Fowlis from the Royal Albert Hall. Among the artists performing are Ry Cooder, Afro Celt Sound System, Al Stewart, Billy Bragg, Shirley Collins, Jim Moray, Fara and Daoiri Farrell, and there are appearances by Ray Davies, Sharleen Spiteri and Nick Lowe.(n)

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: A thoughtful and intimate feature-length portrait of the rock musician, following her shopping for clothes in Paris, hanging out with Sandra Bernhard in New York, spending time in London and taking a special trip back to her home town of Akron, Ohio. The documentary also features Chrissie giving a live performance at one of London's newest venues.(n)

programme.title: The Story of Maths
programme.desc: Marcus du Sautoy discovers how, as Europe fell into the Dark Ages, the development of maths was taken up with vigour in the East. He learns how numeracy made possible great feats of engineering, and how India came up with symbols for zero and negative numbers, as well as concepts of infinity. He then examines the propagation of the knowledge to the West through such figures as Fibonacci.(n)

programme.title: The Bermuda Triangle: Beneath the Waves
programme.desc: Bruce Bernado explores the legend of the region where many planes and ships have disappeared in mysterious circumstances. Using a state-of-the-art submarine, Graham Hawkes reveals how five wrecks ended up 730ft down in the heart of the deadly expanse of water.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.sub-title: Exposed: Magicians, Psychics and Frauds - Storyville.
programme.desc: Documentary chronicling magician James Randi's attempts to expose supposed faith healers, fortune-tellers and psychics who have borrowed tricks from magicians to swindle the masses. The programme examines his rivalry with spoon-bending illusionist Uri Geller, as well as how he exposed evangelist Peter Popoff's use of in-ear receivers in the 1980s.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: The Beauty of Anatomy
programme.desc: Dr Adam Rutherford investigates the story of the two brilliant but controversial Hunter brothers, who transformed both medicine and art in 18th-century Britain. Their belief that students could only learn anatomy by carrying out dissections created an unprecedented demand for dead bodies - as well as a market for the growing trade of body-snatching from graveyards.(n)

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Summer returns, transforming the landscape of the famous national park from a frozen wilderness into the ideal environment for newborn animals. As temperatures rise, grizzly bears teach their young the secrets of survival - but even at this time of year, snow can sweep down from the mountains without warning.(n)

programme.title: Empire of the Tsars: Romanov Russia with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley tells the story of the dynasty that ruled Russia for more than three centuries, including figures such as Peter the Great and Catherine the Great, the struggle against Napoleon in 1812, and the political murders of Nicholas II and his family in 1918. In the first edition, she investigates the beginning of the Romanovs' 300-year reign in Russia, and charts ruthless Tsar Peter the Great's rule, who acceded to the throne at the age of nine.(n)

programme.title: A Timewatch Guide
programme.desc: Vanessa Collingridge explores how the public's view of ancient Egyptian queen Cleopatra has changed over the years, from Roman propaganda through to Shakespeare's portrayal, and in the golden age of Hollywood, where she became a doomed romantic heroine. The presenter seeks the views of academic experts and refers to archive BBC documentaries and drama to explore Cleopatra's personal life and role as a politician, charting how throughout history the leader's image has been subject to myths and cliches.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: The team explores the Arctic Ocean, one of the most hostile environments on Earth, yet one that plays a crucial part in controlling the climate of the planet. Paul Rose and the crew dive beneath the polar ice cap to examine how the ice, the dominant feature of the ocean, is shrinking and how this could affect the rest of the world. Last in the series.(n)

programme.desc: Light heavyweight champion Daniel Cormier faces Anthony Johnson in a blockbuster rematch in Buffalo. Plus, Chris Weidman v Gegard Mousasi and Cynthia Calvillo v Pearl Gonzalez.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen and Sam investigate when former marine Asher Ross is killed by an explosive device hidden in his mobile phone. programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A Navy officer dies following a confrontation involving a dancer and a Sudanese emigre at a strip club. programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.sub-title: Kevin McCloud's Escape to the Wild.
programme.desc: The Grand Designs presenter sets out on a mission to find out if a simpler existence really can make people happier, beginning by travelling to a desert island in the south Pacific archipelago of Tonga to meet a British family who have quit the rat race. Karyn, Boris and their three children live in an off-grid property, with no fresh water or electricity and face regular threats from hurricanes and tsunamis. Kevin finds out how they cope with these challenges and the psychological trials of having just one another for company.(n)

programme.title: Spying on the Royals
programme.desc: The conclusion of the two-part documentary about surveillance on Edward VIII and Wallis Simpson. In the wake of the abdication, the couple took a holiday in America, unaware they were being spied on by US intelligence agencies as well as British. The outbreak of the Second World War saw them move on to Lisbon, where their dealings with a known Nazi collaborator raised concerns for MI5.(n)

programme.title: Homeland

programme.title: The Guard
programme.desc: A laidback Irish policeman has a sharp mind for detective work, but a less than dedicated attitude to enforcing the law. His simple life is disrupted when he is forced to work with an uptight FBI agent in pursuit of an international drug-smuggling operation. Comedy thriller, with Brendan Gleeson, Don Cheadle and Mark Strong.(n)

programme.title: Great British Buildings: Restoration of the Year
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud and Anna Keay present buildings in the Early category - those constructed between the 13th and 16th centuries. Those in the running are Hampton Court Palace, the Royal Hospital in Chelsea, a medieval building in Ledbury, and Hardwick Hall in Derbyshire, where the previously derelict stable block and barns have been revitalised for modern use. At the end of the programme, it is revealed which buildings have been chosen to make the final shortlist.(n)

programme.title: Isis and the Battle for Iraq
programme.desc: Dispatches special investigating the other side of the war against the so-called Islamic State, looking into allegations of torture, execution and sectarian cleansing by the Shia militia against their fellow Iraqis. The film reports from outside Mosul, where Sunni refugees fleeing Isis face a new threat - potential imprisonment and torture by the militia. Reporter Ramita Navai goes undercover to meet victims and discovers that some groups are using the opportunity of the war against Isis to settle sectarian and historic scores.(n)

programme.title: Unreported World
programme.desc: Shaunagh Connaire reports from Lebanon where an estimated one and a half million Syrian refugees have fled the war. She reveals that, despite offers of assistance from the international community, some of those most in need - refugee children with serious medical conditions - are dying while they wait for help. Several developed nations have promised to help the most vulnerable children and resettle them. However, it seems there are limits on medical grounds as to who is being accepted, resulting in some of the sickest children and their families being left stranded.(n)

In Queensbury, Bradford, retired teacher Mary's cottage has lost its country charm and become too expensive for her to keep. Can Phil help make their properties more attractive to buyers?.(n)

She seeks advice from her old boss, former Hooters CEO Coby Brooks, who also went undercover, in his own organisation.
