Meanwhile, McGee's childhood friend, NCIS Special Agent Valerie Page, arrives in town to assist with advanced tactics training. Naval crime drama, guest starring Leslie Hope and Christina Chang.(n)

programme.title: Damaged
programme.desc: A high-school teacher's life is turned upside down when a new student moves into the area and they develop a mutual attraction for each other, leading to a string of undesirable events. Thriller, starring Chris Klein, Merritt Patterson and Tasya Teles. Edited for daytime broadcast.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Sonya demands that Toadie stay out of her life, but he is desperate to be there to protect her. Paige begins acting strangely and Piper helps rush her to the hospital.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Alf unwittingly prevents the bait shop from being set on fire, Justin discovers what Phoebe has done, while John's symptoms worsen and he collapses in an uncontrollable fit.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: MotoGP Highlights
programme.desc: The MotoGP Grand Prix of Argentina. Action from the second round of the season from the Autodromo Termas de Rio Hondo in Santiago del Estero. Marc Marquez entered the 69th campaign of the Grand Prix motorcycle racing competition as defending champion, and was looking to take the chequered flag in Argentina for the second year in succession.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Officers come under attack from a gang of violent armed robbers, while Jon and Chris have their work cut out catching up with a dangerous speeder. Plus, the `Big Blue Van' respond to reports of bottles raining down on the streets.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Tube: Going Underground
programme.desc: Rob Bell examines the history of the Central Line, which at 46 miles is the longest in the Tube's network and connects east with west - transporting 260 million passengers a year. Rob learns that Bank's platforms are curved to avoid the Bank of England's vaults, and investigates a disaster during the Second World War in which 173 people were killed at Bethnal Green station while trying to shelter from an air raid.(n)

programme.title: All New Traffic Cops
programme.sub-title: All New Traffic Cops: Under Attack.
programme.desc: Thieves dragging a stolen generator on one wheel along town and country roads cause chaos, smashing the barriers on a closed level crossing and coming close to causing a train crash. A van with a surprising load is tracked using state-of-the-art technology in a game of cat and mouse, and a high-stakes hunt for a stolen van and mini-digger on the M1 nearly leads to carnage. Jamie Theakston presents.(n)

programme.title: Hummingbird
programme.desc: A haunted special forces soldier returns to London from Afghanistan and assumes another man's identity, hoping to make a fresh start. He is drawn into the city's criminal underworld, where his skills prove valuable to the highest bidder, and plots revenge against the gangster who killed his girlfriend. Crime thriller, with Jason Statham and Agata Buzek.(n)

programme.title: The Ring
programme.desc: A young journalist must investigate a mysterious videotape which seems to cause the death of anyone in a week of viewing it(n)

programme.title: Trade
programme.desc: Adriana is a 13-year-old girl from Mexico City whose kidnapping by sex traffickers sets in motion a desperate mission by her 17-year-old brother, Jorge, to save her(n)

programme.title: The Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: When a plane crash lands in the middle of nowhere, one of the passengers claims he can build a new craft out of the wreckage(n)

programme.title: Hamlet 2
programme.desc: Steve Coogan stars in the comedy Hamlet 2, which follows a drama teacher who tries to put together a production of "Hamlet 2" to rescue his high-school theater department. Catherine Keener co-stars in the Andrew Fleming-helmed production(n)

programme.title: The Man with Two Brains
programme.desc: Hilariously zany comedy staring Steve Martin as Dr. Michael Hfuhruhurr, a recent widower and successful brain surgeon who develops a meaningful relationship...with a bottled brain!(n)

programme.title: No Reservations
programme.desc: Top New York chef Kate has her well-ordered world turned upside-down by the arrival of her orphaned niece at home and a handsome new workmate in the kitchen(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: Director Baz Luhrmann offers a western-cum-war-adventure-cum-romance hybrid that's set in the Australian outback and stars Nicole Kidman and Hugh Jackman. It is 1939 and Lady Sarah Ashley has travelled halfway round the world to persuade her husband to sell his cattle station and return back home to Blighty. But she hasn't anticipated the primitive realities of life in northern Australia, nor has her upbringing prepared her for an encounter with the likes of the rough and ready Drover who is instructed to chaperone her from Darwin to the ranch. But the pair are fated to become much more closely acquainted than either could have imagined. The plot also encompasses the lot of the region's Aboriginal people, via the plight of local lad Nullah, and the first Japanese attacks on the northern territories(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: David Fincher's follow-up to Fight Club is a claustrophobic thriller starring Jodie Foster and Kristen Stewart as a mother and daughter trapped in their new house's safe room by a gang of thieves. The housebreakers are a dynamic trio desperate to get their hands on millions of dollars' worth of bonds the previous owner left behind, and their arrival prompts divorcee Meg and 11-year-old Sarah to take refuge in the vault-like room of the title. Unfortunately for them, that's where the loot is concealed, and Fincher ramps up the tension with some exhilarating camera work as a deadly stand-off ensues(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: After standing in as a female model for a painting by his wife Gerda (Alicia Vikander), Danish artist Einar Wegener (Eddie Redmayne) becomes enamored with his feminine identity and begins living as a woman named Lili Elbe. Although their marriage becomes strained, Gerda stands by Lili as she explores her true self and eventually undergoes one of the world's first gender-reassignment surgeries in the 1930s. This touching biopic was adapted from David Ebershoff's book of the same name, and helmed by director Tom Hooper (The King's Speech)(n)

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea
programme.desc: Ron Howard helms this adaptation of Nathaniel Philbrick's historical novel about the harrowing high-seas encounter that inspired Herman Melville's Moby Dick. In the winter of 1820, the crew of the New England whaling ship the Essex struggle to survive after an attack by a rogue sperm whale leaves them stranded at sea for 90 days. Chris Hemsworth, Cillian Murphy, Ben Whishaw, and Brendan Gleeson co-star(n)

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: The third entry in the popular pulp-adventure series finds Rick O'Connell and wife, Evelyn, in 1940s China with their now-adult son, Alex . Together they battle a centuries-old Chinese emperor and his undead army(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: After walking in on his girlfriend cheating, lawyer Mitch sets up home near the local college. It's just the chance his thirtysomething pals have been waiting for: they turn his new house into a 24-hour party house. Comedy(n)

programme.title: Phone Booth
programme.desc: A dangerous sniper traps a publicist in a public phone booth(n)

programme.title: Traders
programme.desc: A man's business goes under, threatening to derail his posh existence. In a desperate attempt to keep his life as he knows it, he agrees to cash out his entire life savings and put it all on the line in a diabolical, winner-takes-all fight to the death(n)

programme.title: Love and a Bullet
programme.desc: Singer Anthony "Treach" Criss of the band Naughty by Nature stars in this urban action-crime thriller as Malik "The Ghost" Bishop, a former street gang member turned top assassin. Assigned by his boss to stake out and kill the man's innocent girlfriend (Kent Masters King), Malik falls for his target, forcing him to reflect on his violent past, which began in his childhood when he witnessed the murder-suicide of his parents. He's led to make the fateful choice of turning on his superiors instead of carrying out the slaying, a decision that results in a brutal showdown. Love and a Bullet co-stars Bud Sabatino, Freez Luv, and Walter Jones. The film inspired an animated web series entitled "The Contract."(n)

programme.title: Sunshine State
programme.desc: The residents of an oceanside Florida town are bemused by sharp-suited real estate developers. While some consider what they'll do with the pay-out, others fight to keep their place in the sun. Complex, multi-stranded drama(n)

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen
programme.desc: Stephen Norrington's special effect filled action adventure features literary characters fighting the battle between good and evil(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring 2
programme.desc: Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren travel to England to work on an eerie case about an evil disturbance at a London council house(n)

programme.title: Enough
programme.desc: Screenwriter Nicholas Kazan and director Michael Apted combine elements of the hit films Sleeping With the Enemy and Double Jeopardy in this domestic thriller starring actress and recording artist Jennifer Lopez. "J. Lo" stars as Slim, a working-class diner waitress who accepts a date with the dashing Mitch (Bill Campbell), a successful building contractor who warns her about the insincere attentions of another suitor. Swept off her feet by Mitch, Slim soon marries him and gives birth to a daughter, Gracie (Tessa Allen). Her new life of suburban privilege seems idyllic for a few years until Slim discovers that Mitch is a serial philanderer. After his abuse becomes physical, Slim first seeks refuge with a battered woman's group then creates a new identity in another city, but she soon learns that there is no hiding from the resourceful Mitch, who is always able to track her down. After receiving little help from the father (Fred Ward), who abandoned her years ago, or the unsympathetic legal system, Slim resorts to martial arts lessons and a calculated campaign of payback designed to rid her and Gracie of the violent Mitch's presence forever. Enough co-stars Juliette Lewis, Noah Wyle, and Dan Futterman(n)

programme.title: Max Payne
programme.desc: A cop out to avenge the murder of his family sees the investigation take a supernatural turn for the worse(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: An experiment to create a girl who is half-human half-alien goes awry when she breaks out of the lab(n)

programme.title: RocknRolla
programme.desc: A stolen painting and a crooked land deal intertwines the destinies of a Russian mobster, a London gangster and a junkie punk rocker in writer-director Guy Ritchie's stylish caper film(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: A wimpy account manager (James McAvoy) is recruited by a sexy mystery woman (Angelina Jolie) to join a secret society of assassins and avenge the murder of his estranged father. Morgan Freeman costars in this non-stop action thrill ride. Directed by Timur Bekmambetov(n)

programme.desc: William Peter Blatty's Oscar-winning adaptation of his bestseller about a child possessed by a demon(n)

programme.title: The Man Without a Face
programme.desc: Mel Gibson plays a disfigured outcast who forms a close bond with an emotionally neglected 12-year-old(n)

programme.desc: In the third installment of this horror series about a night when all crime is legal, a former police sergeant who refused to murder his son's killer must now act as the head of security for a presidential candidate who wants to end "the Purge."(n)

programme.desc: Rip This Joint. Eric's vandalism prank goes awry; Kitty's cocktail party for herself goes south; and Hyde finds himself going capitalist. Shinsky: Jack Riley. W.B.: Tim Reid. Midge: Tanya Roberts. Eric: Topher Grace. Kitty: Debra Jo Rupp. Kelso: Ashton Kutcher(n)

programme.title: Dr. Dolittle
programme.desc: Betty Thomas directed this adaptation of the classic children's stories by Hugh Lofting (1886-1947), updating the original concepts into the present day. When noted surgeon Dr. John Dolittle (Eddie Murphy) swerves his car to avoid hitting a dog, he hits his head on the windshield, triggering his long-dormant gift for holding conversations with animals. Friends, associates and his wife Lisa (Kristen Wilson), all express concern, but Dr. Dolittle is happy as he takes on new animal clients. Soon Dolittle's clinic becomes a haven for talking rats, birds, and other assorted members of the animal kingdom, and Dolittle's new four-legged and furry friends, in turn, teach him a few things about being human. The effects seamlessly combine Jim Henson Creature Shop animatronics, computer graphics, and real animals, but some viewers might yearn for a return of the Great Pink Sea Snail and Lofting's other imaginative creatures. The 1967 20th Century Fox musical Dr. Dolittle starred Rex Harrison in a strange storyline that began with Dolittle escaping from a lunatic asylum and leaving the Victorian village Puddleby-by-the-Marsh, England, to search the South Seas for the Great Pink Sea Snail. Along the way, he gathered diverse Dolittle denizens and animal anomalies, including the Giant Moon Moth and the famed, two-headed Pushmi-Pullyu. The earlier film spawned the Oscar-winning popular song success, "Talk To The Animals," along with numerous now-forgotten toys, books, and collectibles(n)

programme.title: Kevin Hart: Let Me Explain
programme.desc: In this hilarious, irreverent concert documentary, stand-up specialist Kevin Hart performs his unique blend of observational and deeply personal comedy before a sold-out crowd at New York City's historic Madison Square Garden(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Chinpokomon. Trey Parker and Matt Stone aim their harsh satiric eye at the Pokemon craze in this episode of South Park. Eric, Stan, Kenny, Kyle, and the rest of the children of the town are falling all over themselves in an attempt to get the newest Chinpokomon toys. Slowly, the kids begin speaking a foreign language. An investigation uncovers that Chinpokomon is being used to brainwash kids into Anti-American actions. This typically irreverent episode of South Park references Independence Day and gets big laughs from a very old (and politically incorrect) gag concerning the physical size of various nationalities. "Chinpokomon" first aired November 3, 1999, on Comedy Central(n)

programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond try to solve the problems that increasingly complex cars pose to an ageing population. programme.title: Scrappers
programme.sub-title: Scrappers - Back in the Yard: With or Without You.
programme.desc: Terry is so fed up he hasn't been to work for a week, so he and Lyndsay decide to try a role swap. However, before long safety issues are testing her patience, and she finds her `softly, softly' approach isn't working. programme.title: Scrappers
programme.sub-title: Scrappers - Back in the Yard: The Leopard's Spots.
programme.desc: Terry Walker is forced to break the habit of a lifetime when Lyndsay Walker urges him to hire a management consultant, and the first piece of advice the expert delivers is for the short-tempered boss to deliver more praise to his staff. Terry's new approach to management quickly receives its first test when head of HR Dave `Dotcom' reports one member of the team has been drinking on duty - an offense that has already earned him the sack once. With a breathalyser in hand, Terry prepares to have a stern word with his unruly employee. Meanwhile, a neighbouring yard pulls a friendly prank on Metro Salvage, blanketing the site in white powder, so Terry and his boys decide to respond in kind - with paint grenades and pillows.(n)

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: First Steps. In this first episode animals overcome their first great hurdle - surviving infancy. Flightless barnacle goose chicks face their greatest challenge at the very start of their lives. In order to find food they must leap 400 feet down a cliff. Young fur seals in New Zealand have found the perfect place to learn how to avoid predators like killer whales. The little known long-eared jerboa, deep in the Gobi desert, has the largest ears relative to its body of any animal on earth. On its first night alone it learns how to use its astonishing hearing to detect insect prey in the darkness. Albatross chicks make their first flight from the Pacific island where they were born. But huge tiger sharks are waiting for any that misjudge and land on the sea. Ep. 1(n)

programme.desc: Part two of three. programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part three of three. programme.title: The Lucky One
programme.desc: An Iraq War veteran searches for the woman from a mysterious photo that he credits with saving his life during three tours of duty in this romantic drama adapted from the book by Nicholas Sparks. U.S. Marine sergeant Logan Thibault (Zac Efron) was serving his country overseas when he happened across a discarded photo of a beautiful woman. An inscription on the back read "Keep Safe," yet the photo revealed no clues about either the subject or her whereabouts. Upon returning home to civilian life, Logan conducts his own research and discovers that the woman's name is Beth (Taylor Schilling) and that she cares for dogs at a small-town kennel. Before long, Logan manages to get a job at the kennel, and sets his sights on winning Beth's heart. But it won't be easy because Beth's past experiences have made her wary of relationships. Meanwhile, as Logan works to earn Beth's trust, a dark secret from her past threatens to derail his hope for a happy future together(n)

programme.title: The Lucky One
programme.desc: An Iraq War veteran searches for the woman from a mysterious photo that he credits with saving his life during three tours of duty in this romantic drama adapted from the book by Nicholas Sparks. U.S. Marine sergeant Logan Thibault (Zac Efron) was serving his country overseas when he happened across a discarded photo of a beautiful woman. An inscription on the back read "Keep Safe," yet the photo revealed no clues about either the subject or her whereabouts. Upon returning home to civilian life, Logan conducts his own research and discovers that the woman's name is Beth (Taylor Schilling) and that she cares for dogs at a small-town kennel. Before long, Logan manages to get a job at the kennel, and sets his sights on winning Beth's heart. But it won't be easy because Beth's past experiences have made her wary of relationships. Meanwhile, as Logan works to earn Beth's trust, a dark secret from her past threatens to derail his hope for a happy future together(n)

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: Carrie, Samantha, Charlotte and Miranda return in this comedy drama set four years after the finale of the hugely successful TV series. All the key characters are present and (mostly) correct in the first big-screen version of the franchise, directed by Michael Patrick King (who also directed 10 of the TV episodes). Unsurprisingly, things have moved on for Carrie, Samantha, Charlotte and Miranda. Samantha is living in LA to be close to her now-famous actor lover Smith, but she's far from happy. Miranda is juggling the competing demands on her day-to-day life, and her world is rocked when Steve makes a surprise confession. And, while out looking for a new apartment, Big pops the question to a surprised Carrie. But, this being Sex and the City, there are plenty of plot twists for each of the characters (as well as laughs and the occasional tear for the viewers) before the credits roll..(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores nature's evolutionary anomalies and examines two creatures whose stretched features have given them an edge in the natural world. The chameleon has an extra-long tongue that helps it catch prey and the giraffe's neck is so long it is easily able to reach the tops of trees for food.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough highlights the curiosities that have led to accusations of forgery, but have ultimately helped assist the rethinking of evolution. When early explorers brought the first specimen of a duck-billed platypus to England in 1799, it was considered so bizarre it was deemed a hoax. Similarly, the midwife toad became the centre of a scientific storm in the 1920s that led to accusations of fakery.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough encounters two species with wrinkly skin, where nature has tinkered with the ageing process to different effect. The mole rat retains its looks while growing old and the elephant looks old from birth, yet both creatures live relatively long lives.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough questions why spirals are so widespread in nature. He gleans some answers by examining the narwhal's tusk and the spiral shells found on snails and ammonites, as he continues to discover nature's evolutionary anomalies.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines a zebra's stripes and the wings of a butterfly, as he continues to discover nature's evolutionary anomalies.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the emperor penguin and the wood frog, both of which survive in conditions so cold they seem to defy the laws of nature. The emperor is the only penguin able to breed on Antarctic sea ice during winter, while the wood frog can survive up to 65 per cent of its body mass freezing during its hibernation.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: With the arrival of autumn the Arctic Ocean begins freezing over, and polar bears gather in large numbers on the coast as they await the return of the ice. Two thousand beluga whales head for a particular estuary to thrash against the gravel and exfoliate, while in Antarctica, Adelie penguins take to the sea for the first time and face the danger of leopard seal attacks.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines how the arrival of winter sparks a ruthless battle for survival in the polar regions, with temperatures plummeting to -70C, winds reaching 120mph and day-long darkness. As a blizzard rages, a polar bear treks into the Arctic mountains to give birth, while the entire world population of spectacled eider braves the weather in a giant ice hole. Wolves and bison engage in battle, but alliances are also made, and beneath the snow, voles try to dodge the attacks of great grey owls and weasels.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the life and work of people in the polar regions, including the residents of Norilsk in Siberia, the coldest city on Earth. He also discovers how the Danish armed forces maintain their country's claim to Greenland's natural resources by mounting a 2,000-mile dog sled patrol during the winter, and finds out how a research base at the South Pole is able to cope with being cut off from the outside world for six months at a time.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the emperor penguin and the wood frog, both of which survive in conditions so cold they seem to defy the laws of nature. The emperor is the only penguin able to breed on Antarctic sea ice during winter, while the wood frog can survive up to 65 per cent of its body mass freezing during its hibernation.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: With the arrival of autumn the Arctic Ocean begins freezing over, and polar bears gather in large numbers on the coast as they await the return of the ice. Two thousand beluga whales head for a particular estuary to thrash against the gravel and exfoliate, while in Antarctica, Adelie penguins take to the sea for the first time and face the danger of leopard seal attacks.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines how the arrival of winter sparks a ruthless battle for survival in the polar regions, with temperatures plummeting to -70C, winds reaching 120mph and day-long darkness. As a blizzard rages, a polar bear treks into the Arctic mountains to give birth, while the entire world population of spectacled eider braves the weather in a giant ice hole. Wolves and bison engage in battle, but alliances are also made, and beneath the snow, voles try to dodge the attacks of great grey owls and weasels.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the life and work of people in the polar regions, including the residents of Norilsk in Siberia, the coldest city on Earth. He also discovers how the Danish armed forces maintain their country's claim to Greenland's natural resources by mounting a 2,000-mile dog sled patrol during the winter, and finds out how a research base at the South Pole is able to cope with being cut off from the outside world for six months at a time.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores nature's evolutionary anomalies and examines two creatures whose stretched features have given them an edge in the natural world. The chameleon has an extra-long tongue that helps it catch prey and the giraffe's neck is so long it is easily able to reach the tops of trees for food.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough highlights the curiosities that have led to accusations of forgery, but have ultimately helped assist the rethinking of evolution. When early explorers brought the first specimen of a duck-billed platypus to England in 1799, it was considered so bizarre it was deemed a hoax. Similarly, the midwife toad became the centre of a scientific storm in the 1920s that led to accusations of fakery.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough encounters two species with wrinkly skin, where nature has tinkered with the ageing process to different effect. The mole rat retains its looks while growing old and the elephant looks old from birth, yet both creatures live relatively long lives.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough questions why spirals are so widespread in nature. He gleans some answers by examining the narwhal's tusk and the spiral shells found on snails and ammonites, as he continues to discover nature's evolutionary anomalies.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities

programme.title: Outback Rangers

programme.desc: Chris Packham turns is attention to nature's most hardy survivors, including the penguin, whose wings and body are specially adapted to help conquer a range of habitats.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of the Earth
programme.desc: The documentary examining the Earth's interior, surface and atmosphere returns with an examination of whirlpools, quicksand and rip currents.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Dancing in the Dark - The End of Physics?.
programme.desc: Scientists don't know what most of the universe is made of, with atoms accounting for only four per cent of it and the hypothetical dark matter and energy making up the rest. In the wake of an upgrade to the capabilities of Cern's Large Hadron Collider, scientists hoped to identify the nature of dark matter and reveal its secrets. The stakes are high because if the mystery is not solved, it might mean that physics itself needs a rethink.(n)

programme.title: Gorilla Revisited with David Attenborough
programme.desc: The eminent broadcaster and naturalist remembers his encounter with mountain gorillas in Rwanda, recalling how the sequences for the programme Life on Earth were filmed and considering the success of efforts to conserve the great apes.(n)

programme.desc: When Cheryl and her roommate quarrel, Cheryl moves into her aunt's hotel in downtown L.A. rather than return home to Ohio. She wants to be treated like a woman, and she's drawn to George, a handsome photographer who lives in the hotel(n)

programme.title: Step Brothers
programme.desc: Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby co-stars Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly re-team with that film's director, Adam McKay, to tell the tale of two pampered best friends whose single parents fall in love and decide to marry. McKay and Ferrell share screenwriting credits, and Judd Apatow and Jimmy Miller produce(n)

programme.title: Deuce Bigalow: European Gigolo
programme.desc: This sequel finds Deuce coming out of retirement when his old pimp is accused of killing male prostitutes in Amsterdam(n)

programme.title: Delta Farce
programme.desc: When a hard-luck blue-collar worker and his two best friends are mistaken for Army Reservists by a tough-talking Army sergeant, the plane set to fly them to the front lines of Iraq mistakenly drops them in the middle of Mexico to disastrous results in a freewheeling military comedy starring Larry the Cable Guy, Bill Engvall, and D.J. Qualls. Larry (the Cable Guy) has lost his job and his woman in the short span of 24 hours. Convinced that some suds and target shooting are just the right remedies for a broken, jobless heart, Larry sets out with his next-door neighbor Bill (Engvall) and their trigger-happy pal Everett (Qualls) in order to blast off some rounds and down some brews. Their relaxing weekend soon takes an unexpected turn, however, when hard-case Army sergeant Kilgrove (Keith David) mistakes the trio as slacking Army reservists and loads them in a plane bound for Fallujah. Subsequently air-dropped over Mexico due to pilot error, the clueless, wannabe war heroes become convinced that they're actually in the Middle East and set out to save a rural village from what they assume to be an insurgent uprising. Though the thankful locals champion the noble but dimwitted trio for their heroism, the celebration is short-lived as ruthless warlord Carlos Santana (Danny Trejo) pays a personal visit to the town with a plan to confront the fearless warriors who dared to challenge his iron-fist rule(n)

programme.title: National Treasure: Book of Secrets
programme.desc: Artifact hunter and archaeologist extraordinaire Ben Franklin Gates learns of his own family's implication in the assassination of Abraham Lincoln by John Wilkes Booth. Gates must then locate an elusive diary, not only to clear his family's name, but to unearth and connect several secrets, buried within the book, that point to a massive, global conspiracy(n)

programme.desc: A cowboy plots to steal a $500,000 gold shipment from an avaricious mine owner. Meanwhile, the man hired to kill the cowboy decides to go along with the robbery scheme(n)

programme.title: The X-Files
programme.desc: Rob Bowman's feature film, based on the popular TV series, stars David Duchonovy and Gillian Anderson as special agents Fox Mulder and Dana Scully. The two are in disgrace after failing to stop the bombing of a Federal building in Dallas. But conspiracy theorist Alvin Kurtzwell believes the bodies caught up in the explosion were not only already dead but killed by something agelessly evil. Aided by Cigarette Smoking Man, the duo find themselves caught up in a worldwide conspiracy that could change the future of mankind(n)

programme.title: Dr. Wai: The Scripture With No Words
programme.desc: This comedy is quite a change for Hong Kong martial arts hero Jet Li. Li plays Chow, the writer of a pulp-style adventure serial, who seems to be failing in both his career and his marriage to Monica (Rosamund Kwan). The film also enacts out Chow's story as he writes it: Li also plays the fictional Dr. Wai, a daring adventurer in the tradition of Doc Savage or Indiana Jones. As Chow tries to churn out his story, Dr. Wai pursues a mysterious scroll called "The Scripture Without Words"; the film's transitions between reality and fantasy is reminiscent of films such as Brazil and The Princess Bride(n)

programme.title: Dead Heist
programme.desc: This nerve-wracking chiller is about a crime-boss's bodyguard (D.J. Naylor) who must pull off one last bank job before he can get out of the business. When the caper goes awry, the robbers and their hostages find themselves trapped by mutant zombies who've escaped from an government institution where they were part of a military experiment. Luckily for those barricaded in the bank, a government official (Big Daddy Kane), who worked on the botched tests, comes to the rescue. For some of them(n)

programme.desc: Monumental biopic of the great but controversial US military general, George S Patton. programme.title: Gangs of New York
programme.desc: New York City, 1863. Before there was the city we know today, a city of wealth, power and infinite dreams, New York was a very different place, a fledgling young city where the desire for a better life raged in crime-ridden streets. Here, as the Nations own survival was being tested by the ongoing Civil War, a vast and dangerous underworld was born in the streets. These were the gangs of New York, as portrayed in Herbert Asburys classic book, whose racketeering, bootlegging, swindling, gambling and murdering would become legendary - and whose culture of corruption threatened the very survival of Americas working people. In the young, unfinished City, it was a time of ruthlessness, intolerance and fear. But it was also a time of extraordinary bravery, as those pushed to the edge fought for the freedom of future generations. Director Martin Scorsese sets this epic drama in this defining moment in New York City history, an era whose conflicts helped define who and what makes an American. Against the backdrop of this brave new world unfolds a story about a fatherless sons search for honor, vengeance and the courage to remake his life(n)

programme.title: Mindhunters
programme.desc: Renny Harlin directed this suspenseful thriller about a group of FBI trainees who've gathered to study profiling techniques, only to soon discover that there is a killer among them. Val Kilmer, Christian Slater, LL Cool J, Jonny Lee Miller, Kathryn Morris, Patricia Velasquez(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Sarah Porter, the new Secretary of the Navy, charges Gibbs and the team with finding terrorist group the Brotherhood of Doubt, which was responsible for killing her predecessor. She expects the group's next target to be billionaire Tomas Mendez, who spends his money trying to defeat terrorism, but whose motives may not be entirely altruistic. Meanwhile, Tony flies to Tel Aviv, where new Mossad director Orli Elbaz reveals they have a report of a possible sighting of Ziva at a kibbutz she went to as a child. Crime drama, guest starring Marina Sirtis.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An explosion at an apartment building brings navy officer Terence Keith to the team's attention and it transpires he had been on medication for anxiety, a condition that had led to him being ejected from a pilot's training course. Ducky's profile of Keith suggests that he may be unstable and about to exact revenge for having his dream of becoming a fighter ace taken away from him, and evidence points to him intending to carry out a suicide attack.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A woman is found murdered and Gibbs and McGee are called in when she is discovered to be carrying ID bearing the name Sgt Patricia Moreno, a US marine known to have died several years earlier. The victim is discovered to have come to America from Afghanistan and a necklace reveals a fingerprint that leads the team to a known assassin. Guest starring Lolita Davidovich.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team investigate when naval cryptanalyst Andrew Wells is shot dead in a park outside Baltimore. At the scene, Tony spots a man who was one of his informants from 15 years earlier when he was a police officer, but who went into hiding after a bid to bring down the Russian mobsters he worked for went wrong. Drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team works with Abigail Borin of the Coast Guard Investigative Service after a highly suspicious explosion and fire on board an oil rig kills a US marine corps reservist. Abby detects malware in the platform's computer systems, while Ducky finds traces on the victim's body that lead to a lawyer who works for the oil company. Back in the office, a prankster is bringing some light relief and although the likeliest suspect is Tony, he denies any involvement. Crime drama, guest starring Diane Neal.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The dismembered body parts of an adult-film star are found in a skip, prompting Brenda and the team to look for more clues to solve the puzzle. However, once they begin gathering the evidence, the suspect list gets increasingly longer. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda and the team try to solve the case of a mother and daughter whose drowned bodies have been found by fishermen. As events proceed, a surprising revelation helps them unravel the mystery. Kyra Sedgwick stars.(n)

programme.desc: A boy blames himself for the death of his friend, forcing Brenda to tread lightly to get to the bottom of the case. To make matters worse, the deceased child's mother makes accusations of her own. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The detectives deal with a case of mistaken identity, which is hampering a major investigation. Meanwhile, Brenda is called to testify in Pope's divorce settlement, but finds that both her career and reputation are at risk. Drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.desc: Brenda races to the scene of three murders, but when she arrives the bodies are nowhere to be found. To solve the case, the team must first locate the victims before the hunt for the killer can begin. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.desc: The wife of a crime boss is murdered in FBI custody. programme.desc: The hunt for a missing woman leads Goren and Eames to a political activist's apartment, where they find deadly materials including rat poison - a known bomb-making ingredient. programme.desc: Gibbs is forced to take a step back from work when his increasingly frail father Jackson begs him to help track down an old friend from the Second World War who does not have long left to live. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Petty officer Jody Ray is killed by a hit-and-run driver and evidence points to staff sergeant Justin Dunne, whose guilt seems certain when DiNozzo and McGee find him washing a bloodstained knife when they go to arrest him. However, Dunne tells his lawyer Carrie Clark he was miles away in Falls Church at the time - stabbing bookmaker Donny Sullivan to death. Unable to reveal the truth to the NCIS team, Clark decides to check out the alibi herself. Crime drama, guest starring Salli Richardson-Whitfield (A Town Called Eureka).(n)

programme.desc: The Last Temptation of Krust. Krusty's ancient jokes and politically incorrect impressions go down like a lead balloon at a charity comedy festival - so he decides to spice up his act by adding more alternative, adult-oriented material. Featuring the guest voice of chat show host Jay Leno, alongside comedians Steven Wright and Janeane Garofalo(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Sunday, Cruddy Sunday. After his class takes a field trip to the Post Office, Bart Simpson (voice of Nancy Cartwright) gets to take home once piece of undeliverable mail as a souvenir, and he's given a coupon booklet, which his father Homer (voice of Dan Castellaneta) embraces with no small enthusiasm. While at an auto repair shop for a free wheel balancing, Homer is talked into buying four new tires, and while they're being installed, he chats with fellow customer Wally Kogen (voice of Fred Willard). Wally runs a travel agency, and is organizing a charter trip to the upcoming Super Bowl. Wally offers Homer a free trip in exchange for help rounding up customers, and he enthusiastically agrees. However, once the busload of Springfield's biggest football fans arrives at the stadium for the big game, they discovers their tickets are phonies ("The hologram's missing, and there's no such team as the Spungos, and finally these seem to be printed on some sort of cracker"), and now the guys have to come up with a way to sneak into the biggest professional sporting event of the year. Meanwhile at home, Marge (voice of Julie Kavner) and Lisa (voice of Yeardley Smith) pass the time with a craft kit they got as a present years ago, "Vincent Price's Egg Magic," which leads to a curious telephone encounter with the late actor. "Sunday, Cruddy Sunday" features voice cameos from football stars Troy Aikman, Rosey Grier and Dan Marino, sportscasters John Madden and Pat Summerall, Fox Network mogul Rupert Murdoch, and country music legend Dolly Parton(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Faith Off. Bart is led to believe he has special healing powers after a tent revival(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.desc: The mythical story of Vlad the Impaler's transformation into Dracula is revealed. As the Turkish invade Romania, Vlad goes to the greatest of lengths to fight for his homeland -- even if it means selling his soul and becoming forever doomed as a creature of the night(n)

programme.title: The Black Shield of Falworth
programme.desc: The son of a disgraced medieval nobleman is raised in poverty. With the support of a kindly earl, he gains the chance to train as a knight and reclaim his birthright, proving his worth by fighting to foil a plot to overthrow the king. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Tony Curtis, Janet Leigh, David Farrar and Barbara Rush.(n)

programme.title: Cutthroat Island
programme.desc: A tough female pirate enlists the help of an educated slave in finding the three parts of a map leading to buried treasure. However, one of the pieces is in the hands of her cruel uncle, and she also has to find the loot before her crew mutinies or the British Navy catches up with her. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Geena Davis, Matthew Modine, Frank Langella and Maury Chaykin.(n)

programme.title: Avatar
programme.desc: A paraplegic soldier uses technology that allows him to control a genetically engineered body on a mission to a dangerous jungle world. His assignment is to infiltrate an alien tribe on behalf of a corrupt mining corporation, which wants to drive them from their land. He comes to sympathise with the natives, and helps them fight back against his employers. James Cameron's sci-fi adventure, starring Sam Worthington, Zoe Saldana, Sigourney Weaver and Stephen Lang.(n)

programme.title: Speed 2: Cruise Control
programme.desc: Feisty heroine Annie and her new boyfriend Alex take a cruise in the Bahamas, but the trip becomes a nightmare when they discover a vengeful computer genius - a former employee laid off because of his terminal illness - is also on board. He has secretly programmed the ship to crash into an oil tanker while he steals a cache of diamonds from the cargo. Action thriller sequel, with Sandra Bullock, Jason Patric and Willem Dafoe.(n)

programme.title: The Other Woman
programme.desc: A woman is devastated to learn her boyfriend is actually married, but when she meets his wife, they quickly become friends. When they discover he has a third secret lover, they decide to join forces and teach him a lesson. Comedy, starring Cameron Diaz, Leslie Mann, Kate Upton and Nikolaj Coster-Waldau.(n)

programme.title: Extract
programme.desc: The owner of a manufacturing plant finds his professional and personal lives falling apart. As his company faces closure, a new employee hatches a plan to con him, while he also has to save his marriage after an ill-advised attempt to test his wife's fidelity. Comedy, with Jason Bateman, Mila Kunis, Kristen Wiig and Ben Affleck.(n)

programme.title: The Insider
programme.desc: A scientist is fired from his job with a tobacco company, and agrees to expose his former employers' secrets to a journalist - including the allegation that the company had deliberately increased the addictive quality of cigarettes. Michael Mann's fact-based drama, starring Al Pacino, Russell Crowe, Christopher Plummer, Diane Venora and Philip Baker Hall.(n)

programme.title: The Parent Trap
programme.desc: When twins sisters meet for the first time at summer camp, they decide it is high time their estranged parents got back together again, and hatch an ingenious plan to reunite them by swapping places with each other. Disney comedy, starring Hayley Mills in a dual role as both sisters, alongside Maureen O'Hara, Brian Keith and Leo G Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Diary of a Wimpy Kid
programme.desc: A boy starts a new school determined to be popular and admired, only to find himself instead a target for bullies. He documents his experiences in a journal as he sets out on a series of attempts to gain the respect he feels he deserves - but his every effort ends in disaster. Family comedy, with Zachary Gordon, Robert Capron and Chloe Grace Moretz.(n)

programme.title: Marmaduke
programme.desc: An advertising executive tries to start a new life in California with his family and their lumbering, disaster-prone Great Dane. The friendly but clumsy dog accidentally causes chaos for his owners, until an incident at a surfing competition makes him a local celebrity. Comedy, with Lee Pace, and featuring the voice of Owen Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Ice Age: Dawn of the Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Sid the sloth discovers three eggs - but when they hatch into dinosaurs, he struggles to keep them under control. The creatures' mother comes looking for her offspring and takes them and Sid to an underground world where the giant reptiles never became extinct. Sid's friends, aided by a crazed one-eyed weasel, head for this strange new land to rescue him. Animated adventure sequel, with the voices of John Leguizamo, Denis Leary, Ray Romano and Simon Pegg.(n)

Adventure, starring Nicholas Rowe, Alan Cox and Sophie Ward.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to produce home-grown summer salads in even the most confined garden plot. He also offers advice on the basic principles of dressings, and shows how simple green leaves can form the basis of a roasted peach and bresaola salad with feta and yoghurt.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef uses home-grown produce from his Essex garden to create interesting variations for pizza toppings, including a calzone and a quattro gusti cooked in his traditional wood oven for an authentic rustic taste.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares dishes using strawberries grown in hanging baskets at his Essex plot. He uses the fruit to create a salad with speck and halloumi, rustles up a home-made jam to serve with a creamy rice pudding and presents his take on an old classic - grilled strawberries with Pimm's.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef prepares a selection of dishes using fresh peas and broad beans from his garden and demonstrates not only how easy they are to grow but also the bumper yield that can be achieved. He uses the vegetables as the final touches in a spaghetti and meatball dish, as well as creating `posh beans on toast' and a spicy fritter.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares dishes using homegrown brassicas - a vegetable group that includes cauliflower, broccoli, curly kale and kohlrabi. The chef is surprised to discover how many of these plants can be eaten raw, but it does not stop him using them to prepare curried fritters and a hearty cannelloni.(n)

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Actress Sienna Miller shares her recipe for Tuscan duck ragu, Jamie Oliver cooks a whole salmon in salt and Jimmy Doherty creates a DIY hog roast for the ultimate crackling. Jimmy and Jamie also try to revive the fortunes of the little-known tosset cake, a biscuit associated with the village of Stalmine in Lancashire.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy checks out high-octane joints in Charlotte, North Carolina, with NASCAR driver Clint Bowyer.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy indulges himself on righteously rich recipes in Charlotte, North Carolina, and Los Angeles.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy visits a Korean-Mexican mash-up and in Chinatown, a New Orleans-inspired joint. Then he heads to Charlotte, North Carolina, and a Serbian pizza place.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri makes stops in North Carolina and California as he tastes some killer collard greens and turkey chilli.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri enjoys the taste of the Far East. In Las Vegas, he samples a Japanese spot that prepares sushi and traditional udon, and in Denver he visits a Korean joint.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri heads to Denver, where he tries Indian and Brazilian specialties. Then, in Atlanta, he finds time for some good old American comfort food: meat sandwiches.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri finds a joint cooking up chicken and biscuits and house-cured lox in Atlanta, and across town, he tries Southern grub like brisket burgers and chicken-fried ribs.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri finds a Mexican restaurant-market combo dishing out tasty tacos al pastor and carnitas tamales in Minnesota, and in Denver, he enjoys a unique dessert specialty.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri heads to Massachusetts, where he tastes pickle chips and a scone sandwich. Plus, in Colorado, an NFL pro and Triple-D alum team have green chilli and mile-high burgers.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood: City Bakes
programme.desc: The baker and celebrity chef travels to cities around the world to visit local bakeries and the bakers who work there.(n)

programme.title: Chopped Junior
programme.desc: The junior chefs are asked to create meals their mums would love, but will also impress judges.(n)

programme.title: Jamie and Jimmy's Friday Night Feast
programme.desc: Actress Sienna Miller shares her recipe for Tuscan duck ragu, Jamie Oliver cooks a whole salmon in salt and Jimmy Doherty creates a DIY hog roast for the ultimate crackling. Jimmy and Jamie also try to revive the fortunes of the little-known tosset cake, a biscuit associated with the village of Stalmine in Lancashire.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Kristian, owner of Tavern on Main, fears someone on his staff is stealing donations from his restaurant's annual Thanksgiving Food Drive. Charles Stiles sends in Mystery Diners to see if any employees are taking instead of giving.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Andy, owner of 55 Degree Wine and Link-n-Hops in Los Angeles, believes discrepancies at both his wine shop and restaurant are somehow related. Charles Stiles sends in Mystery Diners Destiney and Rob to investigate.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel helps the chef and owner of Anna Maria's Italian Restaurant in Larchmont, New York whose restaurant has developed a bad reputation despite her rave food reviews.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: A restaurant owner appeals for help to save his Italian restaurant after his staff have created a bad atmosphere, and his business is suffering.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a bar in Astoria, New York, serving slow-roasted lamb ribs with fresh tzatziki.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri searches for global flavour, sample a home-made kraut and kraut burger from a German restaurant in Brighton, Colorado.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.sub-title: You Can Only Get It Here.
programme.desc: Guy tastes a Korean spicy pork burrito with homemade kimchee in San Francisco.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri heads to San Antonio, Texas, to try a 60-year-old drive-in where the owners are putting a Thai twist on a classic Texas barbecue.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri travels America for a taste of the south, including sampling a sandwich with avocado and fresh crab mayonnaise in San Francisco.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri travels to Boulder, Colorado, where he eats traditional grass-fed beef burgers as he witnesses farm-to-table cooking.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina Garten goes back to basics with fresh herbs from the garden as she demonstrates how to make tasty and aromatic meals.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina Garten prepares Greek food using simple supermarket ingredients which double up for a surprise house-warming party.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: A dazzling after-work meal to impress a friend's colleagues. It's Ina to the rescue - after all what are friends for?.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina Garten prepares breakfast on the grill which is packed with warming, meaty flavours.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Bake
programme.desc: Anna shares her favourite shortcake dessert which features strawberries.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Bake
programme.desc: The chef shows how squares can be versatile in their flavour combinations, and shares the secrets on her favourites including fudge brownies.(n)

programme.title: Ace of Cakes
programme.sub-title: A Cake to Take the Cake.
programme.desc: The bakers are challenged to create a life-sized motorcycle cake.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: While the family ships cattle, Ree Drummond gets ahead with dinner and whips up a breakfast of a pancake bar with oven fried bacon, strawberries, and vanilla bean caramel sauce.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond shares recipes for four desserts, including a white chocolate pudding, a fast raspberry fool, a quick dessert panini, and caramel apple sauce to make a sundae.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Easter on the ranch starts with a Good Friday delivery of hot cross buns to friends. Ree makes tortellini primavera and 'krispy' eggs, with a basket of crudites and a spinach dip.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: While the family works cattle, Ree Drummond fills the freezer with components ready to turn into meals at a moment's notice.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Dieters: How to Love Food and Lose Weight
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers create low-calorie versions of their favourite party treats, including fairy cakes, quiche and chilli tacos, and Olly Smith offers advice on wines suitable for slimmers. The duo then reflect on how trying to lose weight has improved their lives and learn whether the Big Dieters have also managed to change their eating habits - before paying a final visit to diabetes expert Roy Taylor and dietician Ashley Adamson to discover if their new diets have yielded the desired results.(n)

programme.title: Chinese Food in Minutes
programme.desc: A pair of professional ice-skaters investigate hot varieties of store cupboard spices at London's Chinatown, before Ching-He Huang teaches them how to prepare peppercorn chicken, prawn-fried rice and crispy scallops.(n)

programme.title: Chinese Food in Minutes
programme.desc: Two rugby players ask Ching-He Huang to help them learn to prepare oriental dishes. She takes them to London's Chinatown in search of ingredients that will provide long-lasting energy, and teaches them to prepare two traditional Chinese dishes, including mushroom tofu in black bean sauce.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef prepares a selection of dishes using fresh peas and broad beans from his garden and demonstrates not only how easy they are to grow but also the bumper yield that can be achieved. He uses the vegetables as the final touches in a spaghetti and meatball dish, as well as creating `posh beans on toast' and a spicy fritter.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares dishes using homegrown brassicas - a vegetable group that includes cauliflower, broccoli, curly kale and kohlrabi. The chef is surprised to discover how many of these plants can be eaten raw, but it does not stop him using them to prepare curried fritters and a hearty cannelloni.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Dieters: How to Love Food and Lose Weight
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers create low-calorie versions of their favourite party treats, including fairy cakes, quiche and chilli tacos, and Olly Smith offers advice on wines suitable for slimmers. The duo then reflect on how trying to lose weight has improved their lives and learn whether the Big Dieters have also managed to change their eating habits - before paying a final visit to diabetes expert Roy Taylor and dietician Ashley Adamson to discover if their new diets have yielded the desired results.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond creates a menu with black beans at the centre, including mango guacamole and taco pizza, as well as grilled veggie burritos and a quick black bean burger.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's sister visits the ranch, so frittata, kale citrus salad, mystery rolls and lemon and lime pound cake are on the menu for an evening of cooking and eating.(n)

programme.title: Korean Food Made Simple
programme.desc: Executive chef Judy Joo samples Korea's finest fish and seafood, from the biggest fish market in Seoul, Noranjin, to the remote clam tents near Busan.(n)

programme.title: Korean Food Made Simple
programme.desc: Executive chef Judy Joo shows us what Koreans love to eat during the heat of a Korean summer in the capital Seoul and on the beaches of Busan.(n)

programme.title: Spring Baking Championship
programme.desc: The six remaining bakers make dippers and sweet fondue, and for the main heat they craft rainbow desserts.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Dieters: How to Love Food and Lose Weight
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers embark on a quest to lose weight while still enjoying the food they love by creating healthier versions of their favourite recipes. They also search for ways to make their lifestyles more active - including swapping their beloved motorbikes for pedal-powered machines - and learn why obesity is an increasingly serious problem in 21st-century Britain.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef explains the value of pickling and preserving home-grown produce and explains why knowledge of these processes has been of vital importance throughout history. He goes on to demonstrate the procedure by pickling courgettes with mint and chilli, as well as aubergines with garlic and oregano.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's 15 Minute Meals
programme.sub-title: Chilli Con Carne Meatballs and Sticky Kicking Chicken.
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates his own brand of fast food by showing viewers how to prepare two quick recipes. He prepares chilli con carne meatballs, sticky kicking chicken, watermelon radish salad and crunchy noodles.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: A cafe in Santa Fe has a native Kenyan chef and serves up fresh fish, such as island spiced banana leaf mahi mahi.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri visits a family bakery crafting a unique take on the turkey for Thanksgiving. Plus, in Santa Fe, a deli is turning out traditional turkey wild rice soup and pumpkin pie.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood: City Bakes
programme.desc: Paul visits the Belgian city of Antwerp and tries traditional dishes such as chocolate, potato fries or waffles, and then creates two recipes of his own.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel helps the owner of the Liberty Bar and Grill in Hoboken whose business is struggling after 14 years.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The team helps restaurant owners who suspect their employees are not doing their jobs correctly. Rosele, boss of Sergio's Italian Gardens in Las Vegas, is concerned about a conflict between her long-time pianist and recently hired magician.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: After experiencing discrepancies with their supply of expensive protein supplements, Larissa and Andrew, owners of Protein House in Las Vegas, contact Charles to help investigate.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin plans an afternoon of activities for an elderly friend and her cronies, but he reckons without Paul's interference. Richard Briers, Penelope Wilton and Peter Egan star.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor is stuck at home while waiting to be called for jury service - but as time ticks on and his frustration grows, he begins to feel as if he is the one on trial. Richard Wilson stars in an episode featuring no other characters.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victor lands himself in a pickle thanks to a conjuring trick that proves to be far from magic, while busybody Mrs Warboys becomes convinced her husband is having an affair. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del seizes a rare opportunity to make a quick profit and bring Trotters Independent Traders into the hi-tech world of satellite communications. Meanwhile, Rodney plunges to the depths of despair as his marriage continues to deteriorate. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Harry Hill in Professor Branestawm Returns
programme.desc: Harry Hill is back as the absent-minded professor with the multiple spectacles, who believes his money troubles are over when Lady Pagwell dies, leaving a substantial sum to fund local inventing. However, scheming local councillor Harold Haggerstone insists on holding a competition to decide who gets the money - and that's when a rival turns up - the self-proclaimed greatest inventor in the world Professor Algebrain. To make matters worse, Branestawm has been neglecting his young assistant Connie - and now she is working with his rival. Comedy drama, co-starring Steve Pemberton, David Mitchell, Vicki Pepperdine, Simon Day and Madeline Holliday.(n)

programme.title: Boomers
programme.desc: They say age is but a number, and every year Joyce, Alan and the gang like to remind themselves of that by attending a 1960s-themed weekend at a seaside resort, and partying their evenings away. However, this time, Alan's in their bad books, having messed up the booking, leaving them with only two rooms between the six of them. Meanwhile, John is determined to prove he's not old and starts by taking on the climbing wall, and Carol bumps into an old friend, which could spell trouble for her relationship with Trevor. Comedy, starring Alison Steadman, Philip Jackson, Russ Abbot and Paula Wilcox.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: An audition gives Raquel the chance of a lifetime - and perhaps more importantly, an excuse to get out of Nelson Mandela House. Del-Boy is as excited as she is about the prospect, but only because he sees himself as the man behind her rapid rise to stardom. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del becomes a showbiz entrepreneur after discovering a sensational Tom Jones-style singer at a local club. Teaming him up with Raquel, he wastes no time in booking the duo at a birthday party for the elderly mother of a local hoodlum - but it soon becomes clear his new signing is not everything he is cracked up to be. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones, with a guest appearance by Philip Pope.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del is invited to a school reunion at the Nag's Head organised by old adversary Roy Slater (Jim Broadbent), who has recently been released from prison and claims to have turned over a new leaf. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: He Ain't Heavy, He's My Uncle.
programme.desc: Uncle Albert falls victim to muggers, so Del-Boy resolves to take the law into his own hands, while Rodney becomes a director in Trotters Independent Traders - and his first job is to give the car a good clean. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del snatches a chance to make a quick profit, leaving gullible Denzil stripped of his redundancy money. Comedy, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Buster Merryfield.(n)

programme.title: Henry IX
programme.desc: New series. Comedy starring Charles Edwards as a king who has a crisis of confidence and tries to modernise the monarchy - despite the objections of his family. With Sally Phillips.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Three Men, a Woman and a Baby.
programme.desc: Rodney and Albert begin to worry the flat will get overcrowded as the birth of Del-Boy Jr approaches, while Del feels well prepared for fatherhood thanks to a stint at antenatal classes with Raquel. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Del-Boy embarks on a new romance with Raquel, an actress he meets through a computer dating agency, while Rodney takes `Nervous Nerys' out for a burn in the three-wheeler - but as ever with the Peckham twosome, nothing goes quite according to plan. Christmas special from 1988, starring David Jason, Nicholas Lyndhurst and Tessa Peake-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: After a day spent house-hunting, the newlyweds take up an invitation from Nessa and Smithy to relax with a trip to the bowling alley. However, when tensions between Gavin and Stacey reach a head at the end of the night, their two friends begin to regret making the offer.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Hapless uncle Bryn organises a special treat for Gwen's birthday. However, his supposedly covert actions do not go as unnoticed as he would like, and an unexpected guest arrives. Meanwhile, Stacey tries to summon the courage to tell Gavin of her big decision.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The newlyweds begin leading separate lives back in their home towns. In Essex, Smithy makes efforts to remind Gavin of the excitement of his bachelor years with a traditional boys' night out. Meanwhile in Barry, Stacey tries to distract herself with a trip to the bingo.(n)

programme.title: I'm Alan Partridge
programme.desc: Alan insults Norfolk's farmers with insensitive on-air remarks about the BSE crisis, and it is not long before they exact a particularly appropriate revenge. Steve Coogan stars, with guest appearances by Simon Pegg and Chris Morris.(n)

programme.title: I'm Alan Partridge
programme.desc: Bored with life at the Linton Travel Tavern, Alan goes looking for excitement in time-honoured fashion - by getting drunk and stealing a traffic cone. Comedy, starring Steve Coogan, Phil Cornwell, Sally Phillips and David Schneider.(n)

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: Nicola accepts an invitation to debate with her shadow Peter Mannion on Richard Bacon's late-night Radio 5 Live programme. However, breaking news changes the whole agenda, ruining both PR teams' well-made plans, and as the airwaves are opened up to listeners, spin doctors converge on the studios. Political comedy, with Rebecca Front and guest star Roger Allam (Ashes to Ashes).(n)

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: With the prime minister away at a summit in Spain, the media starts to consider Nicola as a potential challenger for the party leadership. Malcolm is forced to put aside his responsibilities running the country so he can thwart the rumours and the minister's new-found ambition - just as she is about to launch her `fourth sector' initiative. Political comedy, starring Rebecca Front and Peter Capaldi.(n)

programme.title: jam
programme.sub-title: born dead through your own ar*e.
programme.desc: Offbeat comedy featuring bizarre and surreal sketches. Amelia Bullmore, David Cann, Julia Davis, Kevin Eldon and Mark Heap star.(n)

programme.title: Nighty Night
programme.desc: Cath has the chance to get a little closer to her therapist when he throws a beach party. Jill engineers a meeting with Don's teenage girlfriend, and suggests she could become a model. Julia Davis, Angus Deayton and Rebecca Front star.(n)

programme.title: Human Remains
programme.desc: Spoof documentary charting a couple's impending marriage. As the big day approaches, the cracks begin to show. Stephen is still in love with an athlete called Debbie and Michelle's hopes of looking like Princess Diana seem sure to be dashed. Starring Rob Brydon and Julia Davis, with Ruth Jones and Mark Benton.(n)

programme.desc: Marlene discovers the farmhands concocting a virility potion for Rocky the bull, and manages to sneak a dose into Boycie's coffee. programme.desc: Contemplation of her own mortality leaves Ria feeling she wants to do more with her life, so she ends her relationship with Leonard. Comedy, starring Wendy Craig and Bruce Montague.(n)

programme.desc: Foggy finds an interest in camcorders, much to the annoyance of some country ramblers. When later playing his footage back on Pearl's video machine, it becomes apparent the lens has inadvertently caught her and Howard in a compromising situation. Brian Wilde stars.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: When Auntie Wainwright forces a gigantic tractor wheel on the trio, Foggy decides to craft a vehicle out of it. However, in doing so he manages to prove that the invention of the wheel might not have been such a good idea after all. Bill Owen, Peter Sallis and Brian Wilde star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine

programme.desc: Arkwright attends a former customer's funeral, leaving Granville in charge of the store. However, the miserly shopkeeper has difficulty trusting his nephew to run it properly. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Easy Meals
programme.desc: The chef shares recipes for dishes that can be made well in advance, including a pollock ceviche, Provencal beef stew and a chocolate and croissant bread-and-butter pudding. Plus, Rachel's friends test a recipe while she takes to the sea with a local fisherman.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Easy Meals
programme.desc: The chef creates fuss-free recipes for a fete, including chocolate, toffee and peanut squares, lemon cake, and brown scones with treacle and sesame seeds. She also visits an artisan chocolate-maker and gives members of the Irish Countrywoman's Association a sample of her scones.(n)

programme.title: My Kitchen
programme.desc: Angela Harnett demonstrates from her home kitchen how to cook rib-eye steak with herby garlic butter, Italian-style chips, plus tomato and basil salad.(n)

programme.title: My Kitchen
programme.desc: Angela Harnett demonstrates from her home kitchen how to cook chorizo in red wine, aubergine and spiced chickpeas, plus garlic prawns with sherry.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Great British Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal gives the classic British afternoon tea a unique twist, featuring his own take on the Victoria sandwich cake, an edible stand made out of sponge, and other imaginative treats. For tea, he brews a Darjeeling and hedgerow infusion and cucumber sandwich tea leaves, and there's also a casino inside a country house in Staffordshire, where the guests are able to eat the playing cards, casino chips and even the gambling table. Plus, one final surprise - a teapot that pours Earl Grey chocolate tea.(n)

programme.title: A Cook Abroad
programme.sub-title: A Cook Abroad: Dave Myers' Egypt.
programme.desc: The Hairy Biker fulfils a boyhood dream by visiting the pyramids at Giza, goes to the oasis of Al Fayoum in search of a dish with mythical properties and heads to a place on the banks of the Nile where ancient man first turned to farming. To mark the end of his journey, Dave is invited by a family of Nubians for a feast to celebrate the end of Eid Al Adha, and helps prepare a traditional meal that has become famous across the entire Arab world.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef takes a gastronomic road trip to Istanbul through the countries of the former Byzantine Empire - a melting pot of East and West. His journey begins in the city of Venice, and on the idyllic Greek island of Symi he cooks some of his favourite Venetian dishes including seafood risotto, tiramisu and gnocchi with spider crab.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef continues his gastronomic road trip from Venice to Istanbul taking in the countries of the former Byzantine Empire - a renowned melting pot of East and West. This instalment finds the gastronome in the city of Ravenna, where he discovers Piadinas, a thin Italian flatbread street food dating back to Roman times. He then crosses the Adriatic Sea to Croatia - a first for Rick - and a gets a chance to discover new a wealth of dishes such as pasticada, goat stew with peas and lamb peka.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef continues his journey through Croatia and savours the native oysters of Ston, before crossing the border into Albania, where he is joined by his son Jack and the pair sample local dishes such as chicken jufka and kokoretsi. In his own kitchen on the Greek island of Symi, Rick cooks traditional Albanian dishes, including Lepur Comlek and Tave Kosi.(n)

programme.title: You Gotta Eat Here
programme.desc: John Catucci eats pizzas and burgers in Burlington, heads to Toronto's Hogtown Cure and then dashes to Boston for a great big lobster roll.(n)

programme.title: You Gotta Eat Here
programme.desc: John Catucci visits Hungry Hollow in Georgetown, Ontario, for a barbecue, and learns the secrets to authentic Napoletana pizza.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Another chance to see the 2012 contest, as presenters Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins invite 12 enthusiastic bakers to take part in a contest to determine which of them is Britain's best amateur, facing challenges devised by judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood. To begin with, they tackle an upside down cake, before following Paul's recipe for rum babas, a hybrid of cake and enriched dough that baffles some of the competitors. Finally, they are challenged to produce a show-stopping cake that reveals a hidden design when sliced into. Who will be first to leave?.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The finalists visit Modena in Italy, where they are challenged to work under chef patron Massimo Bottura at the three Michelin-starred Osteria Francescana. They are then put in charge of two dishes each as they cook the restaurant's six-course tasting menu for the judges and a selection of guests, before returning to the MasterChef kitchens to prepare a dish influenced by their experiences.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers revisit the 1970s, a decade which is all too often unfairly stigmatised for its food. They show how a well-prepared chicken cordon bleu and banoffee pie can be a contemporary gastronomic delight, before heading to a restaurant whose menu harks back to that era.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Bread
programme.desc: The master baker demonstrates breads that can be made in under an hour and don't require kneading or proving, making a classic wholemeal soda bread topped with a cheesy Irish rarebit. He also rustles up stout bread with smoked salmon pate and shows how a simple scone recipe can transform a stew into a beef cobbler.(n)

programme.title: James Martin's United Cakes of America
programme.desc: James's road trip to discover the best cakes, buns and fabulous bakes in America continues in Philadelphia, where he makes a fire and ice cake and searches for a pumpple dessert, which is made with sweet pies inside.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: The chef's gastronomic road trip from Venice to Istanbul through the countries of the former Byzantine Empire is nearing its end as he leaves southern Greece for the shores of western Turkey. On the Cesme Peninsula Rick enjoys creamy Armola cheese matured in goat skins, Urla's famous red wine and the ultimate Turkish breakfast. He also cooks the country's iconic dish sultan's delight - a mouth-watering lamb stew on a bed of aubergine puree.(n)
