programme.title: 127 Hours
programme.desc: Forced into a corner, backs against the wall - a season of action, suspense and dread in confined surroundings. Danny Boyle's part Film4-funded, multi Oscar- and Bafta-nominated, fact-based drama stars James Franco as Aaron Ralston, a mountain climber who gets himself into a desperate predicament. When adrenaline junkie Ralston sets off to conquer a canyon in a stunning Utah national park, he has no idea quite how bad his day's going to turn out. His trip starts well enough, when he meets two attractive hikers (Kate Mara and Amber Tamblyn), but it starts its inexorable decline when he heads off to tackle Blue John Canyon - solo, with no means of communication and without having told anyone his plans. So, when he gets his arm stuck under a rock, he's utterly on his own. He has just a miniscule supply of food and water, and - crucially - a small multi-tool. During the 127 hours he's pinned to the canyon wall, Ralston weighs his options, mentally replays the key points of his life and loves, drifts into delirium, and, finally, summons the will-power to commit the act that could give him a slim chance of survival. The squeamish may need to look away and plug their ears when he does so(n)

programme.title: The Perfect Storm
programme.desc: In October 1991, a confluence of weather conditions combined to form a killer storm in t e North Atlantic. Caught in the storm was the sword fishing boat Andrea Gail. Magnificent foreshadowing and anticipation fill this true-life drama while minute details of the fishing boats, their gear and the weather are juxtaposed with the sea adventure. Starring George Clooney, Mark Wahlberg and Diane Lane(n)

programme.desc: Baltimore. Baltimore's racial divide influences the financial situations of a stunt-bike rider, an illegal tattoo artist, a hookah-business owner and a photographer(n)

programme.title: VICE Essentials
programme.desc: Sewers of Bogota. A look at young people in Bogota, Colombia, who live in the sewers due to being targeted by death squads. Also: an artist who uses telescopic photography; and a teenager who lives alone in the Alabama wilderness(n)

programme.title: VICE Essentials
programme.desc: Boy Racer. An investigation of the underground street-racing scene in the U.K(n)

programme.title: VICE Essentials
programme.sub-title: Corruption, Cocaine and Murder in Trinidad
programme.desc: Corruption, Cocaine and Murder in Trinidad. Examining one of the consequences of income inequality in Trinidad, an oil-rich nation: an increase in gang violence and murders(n)

programme.title: 127 Hours
programme.desc: Forced into a corner, backs against the wall - a season of action, suspense and dread in confined surroundings. Danny Boyle's part Film4-funded, multi Oscar- and Bafta-nominated, fact-based drama stars James Franco as Aaron Ralston, a mountain climber who gets himself into a desperate predicament. When adrenaline junkie Ralston sets off to conquer a canyon in a stunning Utah national park, he has no idea quite how bad his day's going to turn out. His trip starts well enough, when he meets two attractive hikers (Kate Mara and Amber Tamblyn), but it starts its inexorable decline when he heads off to tackle Blue John Canyon - solo, with no means of communication and without having told anyone his plans. So, when he gets his arm stuck under a rock, he's utterly on his own. He has just a miniscule supply of food and water, and - crucially - a small multi-tool. During the 127 hours he's pinned to the canyon wall, Ralston weighs his options, mentally replays the key points of his life and loves, drifts into delirium, and, finally, summons the will-power to commit the act that could give him a slim chance of survival. The squeamish may need to look away and plug their ears when he does so(n)

programme.title: Black Market: Dispatches
programme.desc: Underground Fighting. In the first-season finale, young gangs in Japan attempting to separate themselves from the older Yakuza through underground fighting are spotlighted(n)

programme.title: Black Market: Dispatches
programme.desc: Kamikaze Gas Smugglers. Colombian smugglers who steal subsidised gas from Venezuela in order to make a living are spotlighted(n)

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
programme.desc: (2005) Enchanting children's fantasy, based on the classic novel by CS Lewis. When young World War Two evacuee Lucy Pevensie hides in an old wardrobe during a game of hide and seek, she finds herself transported to the magical land of Narnia, locked in eternal winter by the evil White Witch. Her siblings do not believe her when she tells them of this strange new world, but they are soon in Narnia themselves, fighting alongside the noble lion Aslan to defeat the witch and her mighty army.Dir: Andrew Adamson. (T) (Digital Dolby 5.1)(n)

programme.title: The Aviator
programme.desc: Reteaming the director and star of Gangs of New York, Martin Scorcese's The Aviator stars Leonardo DiCaprio as legendary millionaire Howard Hughes. Focusing on the early part of Hughes' adult life, the film chronicles how he built his fortune, beginning as the proprietor of his late father's tool company, then as a Hollywood producer and the owner of RKO studios, and later as an aviation mogul. Alan Alda, Alec Baldwin, and Kate Beckinsale also star(n)

programme.desc: Rell (Jordan Peele) becomes attached to an adorable kitten named Keanu while dealing with a painful breakup. But when he returns home one night with his cousin Clarence (Keegan-Michael Key), he is devastated to learn that his house has been burglarized and his feline friend is missing. The nerdy duo attempt to find the culprits who took Keanu, and they eventually get in way over their heads as their search leads them to infiltrate a violent street gang. programme.title: Genius
programme.desc: Colin Firth stars in this biopic of famous literary editor Max Perkins, which centers on his personal and professional relationship with eccentric author Thomas Wolfe (Jude Law). As Wolfe becomes consumed with his lengthy novels and begins to alienate his lover Aline Bernstein (Nicole Kidman), Perkins struggles to reel in his talent in order to deliver another best-seller for Scribner Publishing during the 1930s. Laura Linney, Guy Pearce, and Dominic West co-star in director Michael Grandage's debut feature film(n)

programme.title: Demolition
programme.desc: In this intriguing dramedy, an investment banker copes with his wife's sudden death by dismantling the machines surrounding him. Meanwhile, his complaints to a vending-machine company spark an unexpected relationship with a customer-service rep(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: Two adult sisters throw one last raging party in their childhood home before it's sold by their parents, with disastrous results(n)

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: Somebody's Dead. In the premiere of an adaptation of Liane Moriarty's novel set in a seemingly idyllic seaside California town, a suspicious death at a school fundraiser exposes rivalries simmering beneath the superficial comity among some of the parents(n)

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: Serious Mothering. Madeline feels slighted by Renata and gets bad news about her community-theatre production; Ziggy asks Jane why they moved to Monterey; Celeste tells Perry they should seek counselling; Nathan and Ed have a tense meeting about their wives(n)

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: Living the Dream. Madeline organizes a trip to compete with Annabella's birthday party to annoy Renata. Meanwhile, Celeste's roller-coaster relationship with Perry continues before their first therapy session with Dr. Reisman; Abigail's guidance counselor wants to meet with Madeline; Principal Nippal announces the theme for the fall fund-raiser; and Jane asks for Madeline's help with Ziggy's family-tree project(n)

programme.title: Big Little Lies
programme.desc: Push Comes to Shove. Nathan hosts a couples dinner for Madeline and Ed to discuss a "parenting paradigm" for Abigail. programme.title: Making of 'The Fate of the Furious'
programme.desc: A look at "The Fate of the Furious," a 2017 thriller that finds Dom being lured back into a life of crime by a mysterious woman who turns him against his own family. The film stars Vin Diesel, Charlize Theron and Dwayne Johnson, and is directed by F. Gary Gray(n)

programme.title: The Last Witch Hunter
programme.desc: An immortal witch hunter faces off against the Witch Queen, who has returned from the dead, in a battle where the fate of humanity hangs in the balance(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: A hugely successful businesswoman is convicted of insider trading and sentenced to prison. After being released, she tries to earn redemption by helping a group of young girls in their quest to sell brownies(n)

programme.title: Resident Evil
programme.desc: The director of Mortal Kombat (1995) adapts another popular video game for the big screen with this gory action thriller. Milla Jovovich and Michelle Rodriguez star as Alice and Rain, two members of a commando team assigned to infiltrate the Hive, an underground research laboratory owned by the faceless conglomerate known as the Umbrella Corporation. A bio-engineered virus has been released into the maze-like Hive, turning the facility's employees into mindless, flesh-eating zombies. A single scratch or bite from one of these rampaging ghouls dooms its victim, so the commandos have their work cut out for them as they attempt to reach the Red Queen, the lab's supercomputer -- and their sole hope of halting the spread of the contagion. Before they can complete their mission, however, the soldiers must overcome a variety of deadly obstacles, including mutant dogs, lasers, and a genetically altered beast known as The Licker, whose strength increases with every victim it slays. Alice and Rain also discover that the release of the virus may not have been an accident, and that a cure may exist somewhere in the deadly Hive. Resident Evil co-stars Eric Mabius, James Purefoy, Martin Crewes, and Colin Salmon(n)

programme.title: Bringing Out the Dead
programme.desc: Frank Pierce has worked in one of the city's most brutal neighbourhoods for years, and the pressure of the job has taken its toll; plagued with self-doubt, he is haunted by the spirits of the people he was not able to save, and while he desperately wants to quit his job, outside forces won't let him walk away(n)

programme.title: Genius
programme.desc: Colin Firth stars in this biopic of famous literary editor Max Perkins, which centers on his personal and professional relationship with eccentric author Thomas Wolfe (Jude Law). As Wolfe becomes consumed with his lengthy novels and begins to alienate his lover Aline Bernstein (Nicole Kidman), Perkins struggles to reel in his talent in order to deliver another best-seller for Scribner Publishing during the 1930s. Laura Linney, Guy Pearce, and Dominic West co-star in director Michael Grandage's debut feature film(n)

programme.desc: Funny and perceptive comedy-drama about the trials and tribulations of parenthood, focussing on four different families all within one extended clan, with Steve Martin heading the cast as an over-protective father having problems with his anxious son. programme.title: Matchstick Men
programme.desc: Ridley Scott directs the crime comedy Matchstick Men, based on the novel of the same name by Eric Garcia. Neurotic con man Roy (Nicolas Cage) suffers from several emotional problems, including obsessive-compulsive disorder. He and his partner Frank (Sam Rockwell) swindle people out of money by posing as money collectors who promise things like tax refunds, package vacations, and other fabulous prizes (which they never get). Frank wants to pull a really big job, but Roy is too consumed with fear and panic attacks to join him. Only cigarettes and his trusty illegal prescription drugs seem to keep him going. When Roy finds himself in desperate need of more pills, he is forced to see legitimate psychotherapist Dr. Klein (Bruce Altman). Roy ends up talking about his emotional damage from a troubled marriage and divorce, which results in the discovery of a child whom he has never met. Dr. Klein suggests that he spend a weekend with the kid, so in walks teenaged Angela (played by twentysomething Alison Lohman). Reluctant to develop his role as a father, Roy also gets heavily involved in Frank's ambitious swindle(n)

programme.desc: Director Brian Robbins' sci-fi comedy stars Eddie Murphy as both a man-sized humanoid spaceship and the diminutive captain of the same vessel. When a piece of extraterrestrial technology crash-lands in young Josh Morrison's bedroom, he initially thinks it's a meteorite. But it's actually an alien device designed to drain the Earth's oceans and save its home planet from salt-depleted doom. And when it fails its mission, a team of 100 tiny aliens are sent to complete the job, arriving amid a fireball on Liberty Island. Tenacious cop Officer Dooley is soon on their trail, while the alien crew start to mutiny over their plans to totally dehydrate the Earth when they discover that the locals are much less primitive than they'd expected(n)

programme.desc: Blonde-haired, blue-eyed women's libber Molly McGrath (Goldie Hawn) quits her teaching job at a comfortable middle-class school to take a new position as varsity football coach at a predominantly black inner-city school. Culture and gender clashes abound; she must win over the hard-boiled youths, convince them to practice hard and show up for class, and convince them they can win football games. Her job begins to take a toll on her family, however, when her ex-husband (James Keach) attempts to take away her daughter, claiming she is neglecting her responsibilities as a mother. programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: Jamal Malik is one question away from winning 20 million rupees in the Indian version of the TV quiz show Who Wants to Be A Millionaire?. As he answers correctly one question after another, the producers suspect he is cheating and have him arrested. The police agents questioning him cannot believe that a slumdog like him can have the knowledge to win the prize and become a millionaire overnight. While trying to prove them it is destiny that placed him there, Jamal will take us back to the events of his childhood that have the clue to the answers. We will learn about how he and his little brother strived to survive in the mean streets of Mumbai and how he met Latika, his one true love. He entered the show knowing she would be watching it and now every question brings him closer to her(n)

programme.title: Stealing Beauty

programme.title: Stargate: Continuum
programme.desc: The Stargate saga continues as an elite military unit races back to Earth following the mysterious disappearance of two key team members, only to find themselves in an alternate reality where the Stargate has never been invented. Somewhere in deep space, the SG-1 team is in serious trouble. Two team members have vanished without a trace, and now the SG-1 unit's only hope for survival is to get back to Earth as quickly as possible. Upon touching down the team is relieved to be home, but deeply disturbed to learn that the reality they just returned to isn't the same one they departed from. In this reality, the Stargate has never been discovered and neither the government nor the military has never even heard of the SG-1 unit. But who altered the Earth's timeline, and why? Upon discovering that a malevolent alien known as Ba'al has been meddling with the planet's timeline in an attempt to conquer Earth, the team must race against time to defeat the most powerful adversary that they have ever faced(n)

But when the head of the newly founded QVC network (Bradley Cooper) gives her a chance to sell her product on live TV, the Miracle Mop becomes a household name. The success of that invention later leads to a home-shopping empire and Joy's ascension to the matriarch of her extended family. David O. programme.title: By the Sea
programme.desc: In 1970s France, a former dancer (Angelina Jolie-Pitt) and her writer husband (Brad Pitt) attempt to rebuild their crumbling marriage by taking an extended vacation to a small coastal town, where they bond with its quirky inhabitants. As he struggles with writer's block and she with her emotional turmoil stemming from their troubled relationship, they try to remember what brought them together fourteen years prior. This film marks the first time in ten years that Angelina Jolie-Pitt and Brad Pitt have starred together, since the 2005 film Mr. and Mrs. Smith. Jolie-Pitt is also the writer and director of the film(n)

programme.title: Snow Angels
programme.desc: Director/screenwriter David Gordon Green adapts Stewart O'Nan's popular novel to the screen in this feature, which tells the parallel tales of a teenager named Arthur (Michael Angarano) and his onetime babysitter Annie (Kate Beckinsale) -- whose turbulent relationship with her estranged husband, Glenn (Sam Rockwell), leads the small-town waitress down a troubled path. Arthur is a high-school student from a dysfunctional family, and does everything in his power to avoid hanging around the house while mom and dad quarrel. When he's not practicing his trombone and performing with the high-school marching band, Arthur can usually be found bussing tables at the local Chinese restaurant and flirting with older waitress Annie. Annie used to be Arthur's babysitter, and is currently struggling to separate from her former high-school sweetheart, Glenn. But being a single mother isn't easy, especially since the troubled Glenn wants nothing more than to clean up his act and reunite his family. Back at school, Arthur and pretty classmate Lila (Olivia Thirlby) have been bonding over their mutual love for all things geeky. Though the casual friendship shows promise of evolving into something more when Lila expresses her true feelings for Arthur, he can't help but becoming distracted by his chaotic family life: his father is moving out of the family home, and his mother is doing everything in her power to maintain some semblance of normalcy. Realizing that happiness is fleeting as his family becomes shattered and Annie experiences a series of distressing encounters with Glenn, Arthur gradually begins to fall for Lisa despite his growing cynicism concerning long-term relationships. Later, on a cold winter morning, Glenn and Annie's past catches up with them in a blinding flash, and the lives of everyone they know are suddenly and irrevocably changed(n)

programme.title: Crooklyn
programme.desc: Spike Lee and his siblings Cinque Lee and Joie Lee co-wrote this nostalgic but unglamorized look at a family growing up in Brooklyn in the 1970s, inspired by their own childhood. Woody Carmichael (Delroy Lindo) is a jazz musician whose career is in a slump; he once made a good living as a session musician, but he has moved away from it to devote himself to more serious music, a choice that has not worked out well from a financial standpoint. His wife Carolyn (Alfre Woodard) works as a school teacher to keep food on the table. The Carmichaels have five children, a bright and introspective daughter named Troy (Zelda Harris) and four sons with a habit of causing trouble, and they all share an apartment in a brownstone in Brooklyn. Crooklyn follows the Carmichaels as the kids learn the funny and painful lessons of growing up, Mom and Dad balance their love for each other against the financial and personal difficulties of the creative life, and they all try to get along with the often eccentric neighbors on their block. Crooklyn's soundtrack is enlivened by classic 70s R&B hits, including selections by Sly and the Family Stone, The Jackson Five, Curtis Mayfield, The Staple Singers, and The Chambers Brothers(n)

programme.desc: Mr. Monk Gets Cabin Fever. Adrian Monk is a highly gifted detective whose career is jeopardised by his overwhelming fear of germs, crowds, small places, and almost everything else...(although he's making progress on milk). Monk's disorder was triggered by the murder of his beloved wife, Trudy, which continues to haunt him as the only unsolved mystery in his career. Ordered to take a leave of absence from the police department, Monk hires Sharona, a nurse who helps him try to get reinstated on the force, and in the process, becomes an unlikely Dr. Watson to his Sherlock Holmes. programme.title: God vs. Satan
programme.desc: This spiritually-themed documentary rests on a central, simple discovery: though the Christian take on the "end of the world" (as described in the Revelation of St. John) has received exhaustive treatment in various films and books, the actual concept of Armageddon - a final battle between God and Satan - is rarely discussed. This program constitutes an unusual exception; it actually dissects clues given in scripture in an attempt to determine truths about what will happen just before the final curtain comes down on the world. It suggests that the said battle will transpire at Meggido, a battlefield that still exists in present-day Israel. The program asks where the stories of Armageddon come from, how they have evolved over the years and how they vary among the three major religions that claim Abraham as a central figure(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible III
programme.desc: Director J.J. Abrams was given directing duties on this, the third entry in the blockbuster Mission: Impossible series, stepping into shoes previously worn by John Woo and Brian De Palma. Tom Cruise returns as super-spy Ethan Hunt for another round of mystery, espionage, and mind-boggling gadgets. When international-weapons dealer and sadistic psycopath Owen Davian (Philip Seymour Hoffman) sets his sights on doing away with Hunt once and for all, the revelation that the madman's plot also involves the murder of Hunt's girlfriend prompts the determined secret agent and his specialized team to leap into action. Also back is Ving Rhames, who again reprises the role of Luther Stickell(n)

programme.title: Peep World
programme.desc: A family's dirty laundry get aired out in public, and not everyone is happy about it in this dark comedy from director Barry W. Blaustein. Nathan (Ben Schwartz) is a writer who has recently published a best-selling novel that's being made into a major motion picture. Nathan is feeling very good about himself, but his siblings aren't so happy for him -- the book is a very thinly disguised version of his family's wildly dysfunctional history, and nearly everyone close to him can see themselves in its key characters. Nathan's older sister, Cheri (Sarah Silverman), a struggling actress, is so outraged that she's considering taking her brother to court, especially since the film version of the book is being shot outside her apartment and her father's new (and much younger) girlfriend (Alicia Witt) has been cast in the role patterned after her. Nathan's book has also become a thorn in the side of wildly irresponsible Joel (Rainn Wilson), who is on the run from loan sharks, and Jack (Michael C. Hall), whose career as an architect is crumbling almost as quickly as his marriage to Laura (Judy Greer). When the family gathers to celebrate the 70th birthday of their father (Ron Rifkin), along with their mother (Lesley Ann Warren) and her new husband (Nicholas Hormann), it makes for an evening with explosive potential. Peep World also features narration by comedian Lewis Black(n)

programme.desc: The third and final series of Chris Chibnall's crime drama set in a Dorset seaside town edges toward its conclusion in the penultimate episode, with important pieces of evidence coming to light against all the key suspects in the rape of Trish Winterman. programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs

In his first week, Paul helps with the arrival of a litter of puppies, meets a neglected, dangerously underweight Staffordshire bull terrier that was found in a park, and assists in the interview of DJ and presenter Neil Fox and his family, who are hoping to adopt a young Jack Russell.(n)

Within minutes he makes a shocking confession of murder. programme.title: Rumor Has It
programme.desc: Jennifer Aniston's engaging performance highlights this cleverly conceived romantic comedy. She plays a journalist who uncovers an old family secret---her mother and grandmother may have been the models for Elaine and Mrs. Robinson in "The Graduate." Screenwriter T.M. Griffin also was hired to direct, but he was replaced by Rob Reiner a few weeks after shooting had begun(n)

programme.title: Tyler Perry's Madea's Witness Protection
programme.desc: In Tyler Perry's Tyler Perry's Madea's Witness Protection, Eugene Levy plays George Needleman, the CFO of a corporation that is about to be exposed as nothing more than a Ponzi scheme that stole millions from various charities. George knew nothing about the company's crimes; he's just the convenient fall guy. It turns out that the operation was also laundering money for the mob, so he agrees to help prosecutors build a case against the other executives and testify in court in exchange for going into hiding. George packs up his much younger second wife (Denise Richards), his bitter teenage daughter (Danielle Campbell), his neglected younger son (Devan Leos), and his dementia-addled mother (Doris Roberts), and together they travel to the safe house that Brian (Tyler Perry), the case's lead prosecutor, has chosen for them. However, that safe house is really the home of Brian's tell-it-like-it-is aunt Madea (also played by Perry), who helps the family get over their personal and legal issues(n)

programme.title: Mr. & Mrs. Smith
programme.desc: Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie star in Doug Liman's all-action thriller as an apparently typical suburban couple, attending marriage counselling in an attempt to reignite their relationship. What neither of them knows is that the other is a highly skilled assassin; until they each get a call for their next job. Accidentally double-booked, they both discover the truth about their spouse's secret existence and are now in danger, not only from their respective organisations, but also from each other. But it's amazing what the frisson of danger can do for a jaded marriage... As well as becoming an off-screen item during filming, Pitt and Jolie play a believable couple on screen, bickering through the mayhem and looking like they actually had fun making the film(n)

programme.title: Little Women: LA
programme.desc: Big Little Lies. The genetics results to determine if Elena's twins have dwarfism are revealed. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Driving instructor Alison Firth hosts the final dinner party in Warwickshire, and hopes that her 1980s disco-themed night featuring a marshmallow competition will impress her guests enough to see her win the cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Four sets of campsite proprietors battle it out to be named best value, with the competition beginning at Amber's Bell Tent Camping in Mannington, Norfolk.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second day of the competition is at Park Farm Camping and Caravan Site in Norfolk, where husband and wife team Derek and Julie Nice are proud to show off their budget, family-friendly site. Former marksman Derek treats his guests to a spot of clay pigeon shooting, bringing out his competitive side.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to 500-year-old Layer Marney Tower in Essex for the third day of the competition, where they are welcomed into luxury glamping lodges by Nick and Sheila Charrington. The guests have little to complain about with the accommodation, but a revelation over dinner changes how they see things. Plus, a treasure hunt organised by the hosts sends one team on a wild goose chase.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Day four is at the Foxhunter Park in Kent, where brother and sister Jane Stacey and Russell Saunders own a caravan site that includes a bistro and entertainment. The accommodation is luxurious but the large scale of the site does not sit well with the campers - and the evening entertainment of a fire-eating limbo dancer leaves most of them cold.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The campers meet for the final time to find out what they thought one another's stay was worth. Amber is offended by Derek's low scoring, while he is thrown by Nick and Sheila's feedback. Russell and Jane have an axe to grind with Derek whose low scoring of their park is made worse by what they see as a personal attack on their hosting, while Nick and Sheila appear to emerge relatively unscathed.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Eco campaigner Hector Christie holds the first dinner party in Devon, hoping his selection of raw food and home-grown produce will win him the £1,000 cash prize. His guests - make-up artist Kirsten Brend, slate salesman Damion Fearnley, theatre nurse Jenny Fox and retired housekeeper Viv Foster - are more interested in the stately home he lives in, so the host reveals an unusual surprise to command their attention.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Make-up artist Kirsten Brend showcases her Danish roots while hosting the second dinner party in Devon, serving a traditional menu to celebrate her heritage and some Eurovision-style entertainment to demonstrate her singing skills.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Slate salesman Damion Fearnley hosts the third dinner party in Devon, hoping to impress his guests with a carefully crafted menu of restaurant quality food. No dish is as simple as it sounds, and Damion has given each one his own little twist. Unfortunately for him, two of the diners seem more intent on taking verbal swipes at each other than bites out of his food.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Theatre nurse Jenny Fox's dinner party in Devon fails to get off to the best start when Damion Fearnley is not impressed by the dishes on offer and Hector Christie takes exception to her choice of main course. Meanwhile, the tension between Viv Foster and Kirsten Brend continues as they show no sign of putting their disagreement behind them.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retired housekeeper Viv Foster hosts the final night in Devon, and feels in confident mood after years of experience serving the rich and famous. She pulls out all the stops to impress with a butler, silver service and her favourite tried and tested recipes. With tension mounting between Viv and Kirsten for some time though, her plans to put on the perfect evening may yet be sabotaged.(n)

programme.title: How to Lose Weight Well
programme.desc: Dr Xand van Tulleken and dietician Hala El-Shafie help Daria and Emma slim down for a birthday bash in seven days, and cafe cook Stacie Stewart helps dieters turn their diets into delicious dishes. Plus, bridesmaids Emma and Elisa go on six week dieting plans for a forthcoming wedding, and entrepreneurs Dom and Adam want to slim down for a corporate summer party in four months. To find out how fasting affects body and mind, Xand also goes on an extreme water-only fast, and investigates if so called zero calorie and negative calorie foods really exist.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Father Jack is hauled off to the local old priests' home to be treated for a strange medical complaint. He is replaced by a younger man - who proceeds to drive everyone crazy by playing jungle music at ear-splitting volume for hours on end. Dermot Morgan and Frank Kelly star.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: The Craggy Island clerics face the prospect of an untimely death during the return flight from a visit to a holy shrine. Jack quickly commandeers the only parachute and bails out, taking the drinks trolley with him - leaving Ted and Dougal to their fate.(n)

programme.title: Man Down
programme.desc: Dan is sent on a diversity course after his complete lack of political correctness alarms headmistress Miss Lipsey, and decides to make an injured Brian part of his idiotic plans. At the beauty salon, Jo hits on the idea of combining two celebrity looks into one genuinely incredible makeover. Comedy, starring Greg Davies and Roisin Conaty.(n)

programme.title: Man Down
programme.desc: After a very unwelcome appraisal of his teaching skills, fate conspires to throw Dan directly into the path of his childhood enemy. Meanwhile, Jo has a new money-making scheme, and Brian is determined to be published in the local paper. Comedy, starring Greg Davies.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A five-year-old is rushed into St George's struggling to breathe, and her mum reveals how she has spent months in Great Ormond Street Hospital after being diagnosed with a rare form of juvenile arthritis. Meanwhile, an 83-year-old man in a confused state arrives in A&E after falling over, and as doctors carry out tests and a CT scan, his wife helps them understand the reason behind his confusion. Plus, a twelve-year-old girl must be brave as she undergoes treatment for a nasty cut on her leg.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to New Jersey's Spanish Pavilion, which is run by two warring brothers whose staff spend more time using their mobile phones than working. The chef plans to turn the eatery's fortunes around, and starts by giving the dining room and menu a modern makeover.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for West Babylon, New York, to help the inexperienced owners of restaurant Classic American deal with their escalating debts. The chef struggles to cope with disorganised staff and an unappealing menu, but quickly realises the real problem lies in the kitchen, where a lack of leadership and communication is causing serious trouble.(n)

programme.title: Man Down
programme.desc: Dan is sent on a diversity course after his complete lack of political correctness alarms headmistress Miss Lipsey, and decides to make an injured Brian part of his idiotic plans. At the beauty salon, Jo hits on the idea of combining two celebrity looks into one genuinely incredible makeover. Comedy, starring Greg Davies and Roisin Conaty.(n)

programme.title: Man Down
programme.desc: After a very unwelcome appraisal of his teaching skills, fate conspires to throw Dan directly into the path of his childhood enemy. Meanwhile, Jo has a new money-making scheme, and Brian is determined to be published in the local paper. Comedy, starring Greg Davies.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: An extended edition in which captains Jon Richardson and Sean Lock are joined by guests Tess Daly, Stephen Mangan, Kian Egan and Tony Law. The teams answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country to see who best understands what is going on in Britain today. Jimmy Carr hosts.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi offers more advice to people buying a second property abroad, this time helping to find the perfect holiday home to be shared by three sisters and their brother in the Poitou-Charentes region of south-western France.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sama Damergi helps Paula Brown to pursue her dream of retiring to the Vendee region of western France. With a budget of £80,000, Paula hopes she will be able to buy a property in which she can keep chickens and grow vegetables.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at Swallows Rest in Weymouth, Dorset, where hosts Jane and Keith Smith are pulling out all the stops to win. However, the colour combinations in the rooms do not go down well with rival B&B owner Ray Chowdhury, and an afternoon of drawing starts some competition between Ray and newlyweds James and Darren Kosa-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants visit the Burley Inn in the New Forest, where newlyweds Darren and James welcome their guests. Donna and David prove to have a critical eye when they discover holes in the sheets, and Jane and Keith have a disagreement over a toilet roll. In the afternoon, the couple reveal their quizmaster skills, before Ray grills them on how they run their B&B over dinner.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to Hotel Montville in Redditch, Worcestershire for the third day of the competition, where first impressions of Ray Chowdhury's unique style and decor are positive. However, room inspections leave Jane and Keith Smith threatening not to stay, and the guests grill their host about his business background at dinner. Although some light relief is given in the form of ice sculpting, breakfast disappoints James and Darren Kosa-Jones, and Ray must face the harsh reality of his guests' opinions at feedback.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to Donna and David's Silverton B&B in Shrewsbury, where the complimentary earplugs soon have Darren and James worrying about the noise from the road outside. A Segway race helps whip up the guests' competitive spirit, Donna gets emotional when her work-life balance is questioned, and chef David proves he can handle the unexpected at breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores. Accusations fly around the table as payments are revealed and the winner announced. Swallows Rest is first up and hosts Jane and Keith want to find out about Ray's colour preferences. Next Darren and James of the Burley Inn quiz Ray over his fussiness around their pine furniture. When it comes to the Silverton, B&B team Donna and David take umbrage with Jane and Keith's comments.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team discover an unusual stone-covered grave as they race against the clock to excavate a Bronze Age cemetery in Fife, before land developers start work on the area.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Castle Howard, Yorkshire: Not a Blot on the Landscape.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team are invited to search for the remains of a medieval village that was razed to make way for Castle Howard in North Yorkshire. With just three days to find evidence of the inhabitants, the dig proves to be something of a challenge - until a dusty cellar yields its secrets.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps Robert and Diana Tayler search for a home in the Dordogne region of south-west France. The couple have already sold their Norfolk house, so are eager to find somewhere new to live as soon as possible.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: A Derbyshire couple go searching the French region of Aude for a home where they can start married life. But while Faye has her heart set on a character property, Philip likes modern clean lines. With £150,000, can Sara Damergi find something they agree on?.(n)

programme.title: Penelope Keith's Hidden Villages
programme.desc: Penelope Keith explores British villages, finding out about their traditions, and also how their way of life is being threatened, beginning with a trip to East Anglia. While there, the presenter attends a regatta on the Norfolk Broads, takes to the skies over the village of Little Snoring, learns to speak like a native of the county and attends a fete - complete with a performance by wheelbarrow display team the Red Sparrows.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the secret life of the animals of Chester Zoo, one of Britain's most popular zoos, using new micro-rig technology to capture the behaviour of the animals and their close relationships with their keepers. In the first episode, the zoo's Asian elephant family welcome a new arrival. Grumpy matriarch Thi has been pregnant for almost two years and is reaching the end of her tether. She's given birth to a stillborn baby in the past, so the keepers have a close eye on her. Cameras also follow Red panda Jung, who has been getting the cold shoulder from his partner Nima since they had two cubs.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Andrew and Lowri Davies embark on a project to build an eco-friendly farmhouse in rural Wales. They opt for state-of-the-art experimental building materials, but their budget quickly spirals out of control. Finding it increasingly difficult to balance financial considerations with their desire for a sustainable home, they fear their dreams will be dashed. Presented by Kevin McCloud.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott Miller has a testing time in the country with some exotic patients, while he and head nurse Emma fall in love with a fox that is unable to make it in the wild.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: The owner of a one-year-old cat born with deformed front legs hopes Professor Noel Fitzpatrick will be able to fit it with two new bionic feet. Plus, a couple bring their Irish Wolfhound to see Noel, hoping he can remove the primary tumour in its leg and replace it with a metal implant.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Twenty-two-year-old motorcyclist Adam is brought into A&E after crashing into a car and being thrown 30 metres. He has possibly injured his neck and spine, and doctors are concerned that he may be at risk of losing his foot due to his severe leg injuries. Meanwhile, a 78-year-old former nurse arrives in St George's after becoming dizzy at her sewing class, and doctors worry she has had a stroke. Plus, 18-year-old Rosa is treated after falling off her bike on the way home from a night out with friends.(n)

programme.title: Lockdown
programme.desc: Women Behind Bars. California's Valley State Prison has all the hallmarks of maximum security: violent inmates, overcrowding, and a heavy drug trade. It is the population that makes it unique. The inmates at Valley State are all women. And with some 3,900 female offenders, it is one of the world's largest women's prisons. With the number of violent incidents on the rise, both staff and inmates take precautions. Inmates get creative when arming themselves. Homemade weapons made with materials like screws and a lighter become a fatal stabbing device. Survival at Valley State Prison for Women means manoeuvring(n)

programme.desc: Stonehenge Decoded examines British archaeologist Mike Parker Pearsons ground-breaking theory one that places this ancient monument at the centre of one the largest prehistoric religious complexes in the world. programme.title: Big Cats: An Amazing Animal Family
programme.desc: Part one of two. Biologist Patrick Aryee explores how cats have evolved throughout the millennia, learning to thrive in inhospitable environments, as well as becoming the world's most popular pet. In the first edition there is spectacular footage of caracals jumping three metres to catch flying birds, and a rare Bornean bay cat, which was thought to have been extinct. Patrick finds out how tigers made the transition from South-east Asia's steamy jungles to the -40C temperatures of Siberia, and meets `lion whisperer' Kevin Richardson.(n)

programme.title: Motorway Cops
programme.desc: The officers face an increase in incidents during the worst winter for 30 years as motorway drivers ignore signs to reduce their speed despite the terrible conditions. Meanwhile, a bus containing more than 40 schoolchildren breaks down in a city centre, and PCs are forced to take two youngsters into temporary police care while searching for a wanted man.(n)

programme.title: Motorway Cops
programme.desc: Police try to thwart the activities of organised criminal gangs from overseas that use Britain's motorways to travel from city to city, stealing to order. However, when officers apprehend suspected thieves, they claim not to understand a word of English, immediately throwing the investigation into disarray.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts visit a one-bedroom mid-terrace cottage in Cornwall, a former chapel in Kent, and a two-bedroom mid-terrace in Co Durham.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts examine properties up for auction, including a 100-year-old barn in Devon and three-bedroom homes in London and Lincolnshire. They follow the sales and talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings, returning to review their progress a few months later.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Bury.
programme.desc: Two years ago, Michelle and Rod Malone set about adapting their home after daughter Maddie contracted a rare brain disease that left her struggling to walk and talk. However, unforeseen problems with the project left them living in just a couple of rooms in an unsafe house. Enter Nick Knowles and the DIY SOS builders, bolstered by an army of local tradespeople, to complete what the Malones started and give it a few finishing touches, courtesy of flamboyant designer Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Cumbria.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team meet Rob and Michelle Wall and their son Noah. The couple live in a small 18th-century house in Cumbria, which is currently a half-finished renovation project that had to be put on hold when Noah was born with spina bifida. Designer Charlie Luxton is tasked with making the cold and unsafe property a special haven for the family - and as always an army of local tradesmen turn out in force to help make the dream a reality.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Aled Jones helps Michelle and Robin, who want to trade life in Herefordshire for a rural pad in the Chilterns on a budget of £500,000. He also pays a visit to the Hell Fire Caves, a notorious private members' club built by a former Chancellor of the Exchequer.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A property expert helps Surrey couple Alistair and Debbie, who want to buy their dream home in North Devon, and have a million pounds to invest in it.(n)

programme.title: Fantasy Homes by the Sea
programme.desc: Jenni Falconer helps a Northamptonshire couple find their dream coastal home in Italy's Abruzzo region.(n)

programme.title: Fantasy Homes by the Sea
programme.desc: Jenni Falconer helps a couple of diving enthusiasts from London find a house on the Jurassic coast near Weymouth, Dorset.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Basildon.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Basildon, Essex, to meet nine-year-old Brandon, who suffers a severe form of epilepsy and can have up to 30 seizures a day. He requires 24-hour care and mum Jenny can't let him out of her sight for a moment - and to make matters worse, the family home simply isn't safe enough for the youngster. Luckily, the local tradesmen have heard of the family's plight and arrive in force to help Nick and the team transform the home, with designer Naomi Cleaver on hand to ensure they don't stray too far from her vision.(n)

programme.title: Obsessive Compulsive Cleaners
programme.desc: Sales rep Louise spends up to 30 hours a week cleaning her two-bedroom house in Darwen, Lancashire. She travels to Portsmouth to help Tim, who only gives his kitchen some attention at Easter and Christmas. Meanwhile, Victoria, who racks up more than 40 hours a week keeping her home spotless, visits computer technician Lesley, whose three-bedroom flat hasn't had a proper clean in 19 years.(n)

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: The Oxford Street Security Team deals with a disgruntled customer, and a department store's staff work hard to unveil their Christmas lights. Meanwhile, police are called to a squabble at one of Britain's busiest stations, a `live cooking' experiment goes wrong at a hotel, and a busker looks for their big break.(n)

programme.title: Embarrassing Bodies
programme.desc: Dr Dawn Harper examines a woman who needs reconstructive surgery, and asks members of a group of roller-derby girls to share their concerns about checking for breast cancer. The medics also meet a man with a facial disfigurement, and the mobile clinic visits Weston-super-Mare, north Somerset, where Dr Pixie McKenna speaks to a man with a painful condition.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Catherine and Simon went through years of fertility treatment to have their first son, which took a toll on their love life, but five years later, awaiting an elective C-section for their second baby, it's a different story - a spontaneous romantic evening resulted in an unexpected positive pregnancy test. Heather ran into complications during her first pregnancy and had to deliver twins at 24 weeks. They pulled through, but cerebral palsy and other issues have meant she is now a full-time carer to them both. She also has Alfie, and after he was born, she and partner Dan decided they would have a fourth child to give him a companion to help share the responsibility of siblings with a disability. Christian couple Naomi and Dan tied the knot young and had their first child 13 months ago. Now, they're back at Southmead for baby number two.(n)

programme.title: Babies: Special Delivery
programme.desc: Following a woman with a rare clotting disorder that carries a serious risk of miscarriage, and another whose blood type is incompatible with her anaemic baby.(n)

programme.title: Super Rich: Billion Dollar Hotel
programme.desc: Shaped like a giant sail and standing more than 1,000ft tall, the Burj Al Arab in Dubai cost an estimated £1billion to build, and has been dubbed the world's most luxurious hotel. Guests paying anything up to £10,000 a night expect only the highest of standards, so what does it take for the staff to satisfy these demanding customers? This programme follows the stories of a variety of visitors, from the King of Uganda to a firefighter who has saved up months of wages, and the workers who serve them.(n)

programme.desc: Film-maker Vanessa Engle's insight into the exclusive world of private medicine continues with more stories of cosmetic surgery along central London's medical thoroughfare. Twenty-seven-year-old Emma Tallon wants liposuction on her thighs, care worker Michael Pulman believes a £7,500 hair transplant will change his life and 72-year-old Andrea Carter prepares to undergo a further surgical procedure.(n)

programme.title: Born to Kill
programme.desc: Canadian couple Paul Bernardo and Karla Homolka appeared to epitomise love's young dream when they were married, but they were serial killers who raped and murdered three teenage girls - one of them Homolka's 15-year-old sister Tammy. This film delves into their backgrounds and talks to those who knew them in an effort to find out what turned them into killers, while detectives, journalists and criminal psychologists also offer an insight into their motives.(n)

programme.title: Hour of Power

programme.title: Modern Family

Julie Bowen stars in a novel episode filmed entirely on Apple devices, with Ty Burrell, Ed O'Neill and Sarah Hyland.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay and Claire shoot an advert to rival a competitor's catchy new campaign - but creative differences threaten to tear the father and daughter apart. Phil, Luke and Manny join forces to take down a Peeping Tom who has been using a drone to spy on a sunbathing Gloria, Cam worries about Lily's lack of singing skills ahead of a talent show, and Haley has a confession for Andy when he's rushed to hospital with appendicitis.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Haley takes Alex to a concert, where not only does she get her sister drunk, but she also inadvertently introduces her to a sleazy guy going by the name of Weasel. programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil thinks he's found the perfect present for Jay's birthday. Meanwhile, a difficult encounter is on the cards for Andy and Haley. Starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen.(n)

programme.desc: The team is forced to perform invasive surgery on a homeless girl, and discovers a complex relationship with her mother when she arrives at her estranged daughter's bedside. Meanwhile, Taub has a difficult time trying to connect with his infant daughters. Medical drama, starring Hugh Laurie and Peter Jacobson.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Baez investigate the kidnapping of a child whose parents aren't as willing to co-operate with the detectives as they would like. But when links to a Croatian mobster are discovered, their reticence becomes more understandable. Meanwhile, Jamie and Eddie go undercover in a jewellery shop in an attempt to stop a string of robberies, and Frank tries to help an NYPD chaplain who admits to being in crisis following his arrest for drink-driving. Starring Tom Selleck, Donnie Wahlberg, Bridget Moynahan, Will Estes and Len Cariou.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The expansion of Britain's empire through exploration and invention as the Industrial Revolution transformed society and the economy - though the rise of mechanised factories was not welcomed by all. The programme also explores the colonisation of Australia and the advances in 19th-century technology that turned the Crimean War into one of the most brutal conflicts in military history. With contributions by Jessie J, Lily Cole and Dougray Scott.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Santos and Vinick go on air for a debate, in a special episode originally broadcast live and unrehearsed in America. Forrest Sawyer is drafted in to raise issues and generally oversee proceedings. Starring Jimmy Smits and Alan Alda as the rival politicians.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The Santos campaign faces a dilemma when a scheduled visit to Los Angeles is thrown into doubt when an unarmed boy is shot by a Latino police officer. Meanwhile, CJ intervenes in a dispute between China and Kazakhstan.(n)

programme.title: House
